"is located in the Northern Range on the island of Trinidad , northeast of the town of Arima . eos"
"only recorded eruptive activity was in march - april 1982 , when El_Chichon produced a one km - wide caldera that then filled with an acidic crater lake . The eruption killed around 2,000 people who lived near El_Chichon . eos"
"would not be counted as a separate peak from El_Diente_Peak higher neighbor Mount Wilson . However the 3/4 mile ( 1.2 km ) connecting ridge is a significant climbing challenge ( Class 4/5 ) , making El_Diente_Peak more independent than El_Diente_Peak prominence would indicate . Hence El_Diente_Peak is often regarded as a fully - fledged fourteener . eos"
"is a cinder cone volcano in Michoacán , central Mexico , on the SW slope of the central plateau , 33 mi/53 km SE of Uruapan ( also know to be located in an area known as the Michoacan - Guanajuato volcanic field ) . El_Jorullo has four smaller cinder cones which have grown from El_Jorullo . The vents of El_Jorullo are aligned in a northeast to southwest direction . eos"
"crater is about 1,300 by 1,640 ft ( 400 by 500 m ) wide and 490 ft ( 150 m ) deep . El_Jorullo is one of two known volcanos to have developed in Mexico in recent history . The second , born about 183 years later , was named Parícutin after a nearby village that it eventually destroyed . eos"
"did destroy what had been a rich agricultural area . El_Jorullo grew 820 ft ( 250 m ) from the ground in the first six weeks . eos"

Electric_Peak was named during the first ascent in 1872 by the United States Geological Survey . Members of the Hayden Survey led by Henry Gannett experienced electrical discharges from their hands and hair after a lightning event on the summit . eos"

"is located at the southern end of the Sangre de Cristo Range , approximately 1/2 mile ( 1 km ) northwest of Blanca Peak . Ellingwood_Point lies on the border between Alamosa County and Huerfano County . Ellingwood_Point is named for Albert Russell Ellingwood , an early pioneer of climbing in the Western United States and in Colorado in particular . eos"
"lies on the border between Alamosa County and Huerfano County . Ellingwood_Point is named for Albert Russell Ellingwood , an early pioneer of climbing in the Western United States and in Colorado in particular . Ellingwood_Point only barely qualifies as an independent peak under the 300 foot topographic prominence cutoff which is standard in Colorado . eos"
"parent peak , Blanca Peak . Hence Ellingwood_Point inclusion in fourteener lists has been somewhat controversial . However most authorities do consider Ellingwood_Point a true fourteener . eos"

"shorter peak is 1,206 meters high . Fichtelberg was the highest mountain of the German Democratic Republic . Fichtelberg towers above the holiday and winter sports destination of Oberwiesenthal , where a cablecar system is located . eos"
"is a mountain range in north - eastern Papua New Guinea , at 5.8 S 146.1 E The unnamed highest point of Finisterre_Range 5 ° 57 ' 15S , 146 ° 22 ' 30E , which is ranked 45th in the world by prominence , is usually quoted at 4,175 m , but SRTM data suggests that it is nearer to 4,120 m. Finisterre_Range runs into the Saruwaged Range to the east and together they form a natural barrier between the Ramu and Markham valleys to the south and Vitiaz Strait to the north . Many rivers originate in Finisterre_Range , including the Ramu . The Finisterre Range campaign ( 1943 - 44 ) of World War II , including a series of actions known as Battle of Shaggy Ridge , saw fierce fighting between Australian and Japanese forces . eos"
"is a 3,510-foot ( 1,070 m ) mountain in the US state of Alaska , located in Chugach State Park just east of Anchorage . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is the most climbed mountain in the state . Flattop_Mountain_Anchorage_Alaska is usually reached by driving to the Glen Alps trailhead and following a well - maintained 1.5-mile ( 2.4-km ) trail , with an elevation gain of 1280 feet ( 390 m ) from the parking lot to the summit . eos"
"was first climbed by J D. James with guide Ambros Supersaxo in july 1889 . The imposing north face was first ascended by E R. Blanchet with guides Oskar Supersaxo and Kaspar Mooser on 25 july 1927 . eos"
"is named for American explorer John C Fremont who climbed Fremont_Peak_Wyoming with Charles Preuss and Johnny Janisse on august 13 to august 15 , 1842 . Kit Carson had been with the climbing party on its first attempt at Fremont_Peak_Wyoming , but had gone back for supplies the day Fremont and his men reached the summit . eos"
"was long mistaken for the highest mountain in the Rocky Mountains . Fremont_Peak_Wyoming is located on the Continental Divide and Fremont_Peak_Wyoming is the second highest peak in the Wind River Range after Gannett Peak . The east flank of Fremont_Peak_Wyoming is in the Fitzpatrick Wilderness of Shoshone National Forest , while the west side is in the Bridger Wilderness of Bridger - Teton National Forest . eos"
". Due to the remote location and difficult ascent , most mountain climbers spend a total of three to five days hiking up to Fremont_Peak_Wyoming , climbing to the summit and then later hiking back to their starting point . eos"

"from Tibet . Gangkhar_Puensum , alternative transliteration Gangkar Punsum or Gankar Punzum ( meaning 3 mountain siblings '' ) , had Gangkhar_Puensum altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . eos"
", alternative transliteration Gangkar Punsum or Gankar Punzum ( meaning 3 mountain siblings '' ) , had Gangkhar_Puensum altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . eos"
"altitude first measured in 1922 but maps of the region are not at all accurate and Gangkhar_Puensum is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . The book of the 1986 British expedition gives Gangkhar_Puensum height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . eos"
"is shown in different locations and with markedly different heights . Indeed , because of inadequate mapping , the first team to attempt the summit was unable to find Gangkhar_Puensum at all . The book of the 1986 British expedition gives Gangkhar_Puensum height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . eos"
"height as 24,770 feet and states that Gangkhar_Puensum is completely inside Bhutan , whereas the nearby Kula Kangri is completely inside Tibet . Kula Kangri , 7554 metres , is a separate mountain 30 km to the northeast which was first climbed in 1986 . It is variously mapped and described as being in Tibet or Bhutan . eos"
"may keep Gangkhar_Puensum unique status for some time : Any higher unclimbed peaks in the world are likely to be subsidiary tops , not separate mountains . In 1998 a Japanese expedition secured permission from the Chinese Mountaineering Association to climb Gangkhar_Puensum , but permission was withdrawn because of a political issue with Bhutan . Instead , in 1999 , the team set off from Tibet and successfully climbed the 7535 metre subsidiary peak , Liankang Kangri ( also known as Gangkhar Puensum North ) . eos"
", described as ` ` the highest peak in Bhutan , '' at 7570 metres . This elevation is supported by Japanese sources , in turn based on Chinese sources . Gangkhar_Puensum has not been surveyed by Bhutan . eos"
". Minor Glacier is situated in the western cirque of Gannett_Peak while Dinwoody and Gooseneck Glaciers can be found on the southeast side of Gannett_Peak . Gannett_Peak is commonly climbed on a four to six day round - trip , and Gannett_Peak is considered amongst mountaineers as second only to Alaska 's Denali in difficulty of state high points . eos"
"is commonly climbed on a four to six day round - trip , and Gannett_Peak is considered amongst mountaineers as second only to Alaska 's Denali in difficulty of state high points . However , many climbers rank Gannett_Peak behind both Denali and Montana 's Granite Peak , which , in 1923 , was the last state high point climbed . eos"
"is a summit in the Gasherbrum massif of the Baltoro Muztagh , a subrange of the Karakoram on the border between Pakistan and China , in the region of Baltistan . Gasherbrum_III is situated between Gasherbrum II and IV . Gasherbrum_III fails to meet a 500 metre topographic prominence cutoff to be an independent mountain ; hence Gasherbrum_III can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . eos"
"can be considered a subpeak of Gasherbrum II . Gasherbrum_III was one of the highest unclimbed summits in the world up to Gasherbrum_III first ascent in 1975 , by Wanda Rutkiewicz , Alison Chadwick - Onyszkiewicz , Janusz Onyszkiewicz and Krystof Zdzitowiecki , members of a Polish expedition . eos"
"was one of the highest unclimbed summits in the world up to Gasherbrum_III first ascent in 1975 , by Wanda Rutkiewicz , Alison Chadwick - Onyszkiewicz , Janusz Onyszkiewicz and Krystof Zdzitowiecki , members of a Polish expedition . eos"
"is one of the peaks in the Gasherbrum massif . The Gasherbrums are a remote group of peaks located at the northeastern end of the Baltoro Glacier in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . The massif contains three of the world 's 8,000 metre peaks ( if one includes Broad Peak ) . eos"
"is a mountain in the Gasherbrum massif , located in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . Gasherbrum is a remote group of peaks located at the northeastern end of the Baltoro Glacier in the Karakoram range of the Himalaya . The massif contains three of the world 's 8,000 metre peaks ( if one includes Broad Peak ) . eos"

"attractions , as well as Glacier_Peak hazards , tend to be overlooked . Yet since the end of the last ice age , Glacier_Peak has produced some of the largest and most explosive eruptions in the state . During this time period , Glacier_Peak has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . eos"
"has produced some of the largest and most explosive eruptions in the state . During this time period , Glacier_Peak has erupted multiple times during at least six separate episodes , most recently about 200 - 300 years ago . The stunning snow - capped volcanoes of Washington have long been recognized by Native Americans in their language and legends , and they immediately caught the eyes of US and European explorers in the late 18th and early 19th centuries . eos"
"appear on a published map under Glacier_Peak current name . Glacier_Peak is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . eos"
"current name . Glacier_Peak is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . eos"
"is situated in Snohomish County , only 70 miles ( 112 km ) northeast of Seattle - closer to that city than any volcano except Mount Rainier . But unlike Mount Rainier , Glacier_Peak rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . Yet Glacier_Peak has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . eos"
"rises only a few thousand feet above neighboring peaks , and from coastal communities Glacier_Peak appears merely as a high point along a snowy saw - toothed skyline . Yet Glacier_Peak has been one of the most active of Washington 's volcanoes . Since the continental ice sheets receded from the region , Glacier_Peak has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . eos"
"has erupted repeatedly during at least six episodes . Two of these eruptions were among the largest in Washington during the past 15,000 years . eos"

"is the highest peak on the island . Golden_Hinde_mountain is located near the centre of the 2,450 km ² ( 605,000 acre ) Strathcona Provincial Park , at the head of Wolf River and to the west of Buttle Lake , about east of the community of Gold River . Golden_Hinde_mountain is popular with experienced backcountry climbers , having been first ascended in 1913 . eos"
"is popular with experienced backcountry climbers , having been first ascended in 1913 . Golden_Hinde_mountain is made of basalt which is part of the Karmutsen Formation . Golden_Hinde_mountain was named for Sir Francis Drake 's ship , the Golden Hinde , by an early fur - trading captain , who was reminded of Drake 's ship as sunset hit Golden_Hinde_mountain , Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . eos"
", Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . The present name was n't officially conferred until 1938 , but this was done after a reference to Golden_Hinde_mountain in one of logs of the early fur - trading captains , who was reminded of Drake 's ship as the golden light of sunset hit Golden_Hinde_mountain , Golden_Hinde_mountain is visible from the west coast of the Island . The alternative name ` ` The Rooster 's Comb '' was used by early alpinists because of Golden_Hinde_mountain appearance . eos"

"is the easternmost 7000 m peak in the world and the third highest peak outside of the Himalaya / Karakoram . Gongga_Shan has large vertical relief over the deep nearby gorges . A rope way has been constructed that can transport tourists across the glacier below Gongga_Shan to a cable car station at 5000 meter altitude . eos"
"is close to Mont Blanc on the nearby border with France , but Gran_Paradiso lies entirely within Italian territory . Cowell , W Dundas , J Payot and J Tairraz . eos"

"( 3,962 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . The first ascent of Grand_Cornier was made via the east ridge by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and F Biner on 16 june 1865 . The Mountet hut ( 2,886 m ) and Moiry hut ( 2,825 m ) are used for the normal routes . eos"
"was named after the Teton Sioux tribe of Native Americans . There is a controversy over who made the first ascent of Grand_Teton . Nathaniel Langford and James Stevenson claimed to reach the summit on july 29 , 1872 . eos"
". Nathaniel Langford and James Stevenson claimed to reach the summit on july 29 , 1872 . However , their description and sketches match the summit of The Enclosure : side peak of Grand_Teton . eos"
"( Pointe Walker ) was by Horace Walker with guides Melchior Anderegg , Johann Jaun and Julien Grange on 30 june 1868 . The second - highest peak on Grandes_Jorasses ( Pointe Whymper , 4,184 m ) was first climbed by Edward Whymper , Christian Almer , Michel Croz and Franz Biner on june 24 1865 , using what has become the normal route of ascent and the one followed by Walker 's party in 1868 . The other summits on Grandes_Jorasses are Pointe Croz ( 4,110 m ) , Pointe Margherita ( 4,065 m ) , Pointe Elena ( 4,045 m ) and Pointe Young ( 3,996 m ) . eos"
"are Pointe Croz ( 4,110 m ) , Pointe Margherita ( 4,065 m ) , Pointe Elena ( 4,045 m ) and Pointe Young ( 3,996 m ) . eos"
"is 10 mi north of the Wyoming border , southwest of Columbus , Montana . Granite_Peak_Montana is one of the most difficult US state highpoint ascents , due to technical climbing , poor weather , and route finding . Granite_Peak_Montana first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . eos"
"is one of the most difficult US state highpoint ascents , due to technical climbing , poor weather , and route finding . Granite_Peak_Montana first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . Granite_Peak_Montana was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed . eos"
"first ascent was made by Elers Koch on august 29 , 1923 after several failed attempts by others . Granite_Peak_Montana was the last of the state highpoints to be climbed . Today , climbers typically spend two or three days ascending Granite_Peak_Montana , stopping over on the Froze - to - Death Plateau . eos"
", stopping over on the Froze - to - Death Plateau . However , other climbers choose to ascend Granite_Peak_Montana in a single day . Please be cautious at the snow bridge . eos"
"is nearly always mentioned in conjunction with nearby Torreys Peak . Grays_Peak is located on the Continental Divide , as well as the boundary between Clear Creek County and Summit County . Grays_Peak summit is the highest point exactly on the Continental Divide . eos"
"is considered to be an easy hike by fourteener standards , and Grays_Peak is very popular among weekend climbers . Usually a climb to the summit of Grays_Peak is accompanied by continuing on to Torreys Peak , less than a mile away . The main trail departs from Stevens Gulch , to the northeast . eos"

"is a mountain in the Bernese Alps range of the Swiss Alps with a height exceeding 4,000 metres . The starting point for the usual ascent by the Grünegghorn and the Southwestern Ridge is the Konkordiahütte alpine hut at 2850 m , which can be reached from Fiesch ( 1049 m ) . The first ascent was undertaken on august 7 , 1865 by Peter Michel , Edmund von Fellenberg , Peter Egger and Peter Inäbnit . eos"

"( also known as Haltitunturi , Haltia or Haltiatunturi - tunturi meaning fell - and Háldi in Sámi ) is located in the municipality of Enontekiö in the province of Lapland at the border between Finland and Norway . The summit of Halti at 1,365 m is actually in Norway and it is known as Ráisduattarháldi . The highest point in Finland is a spur of Ráisduattarháldi at 1,324 m known as Hálditšohkka at the border of Norway . eos"
"was named in the late 1850s by Lieutenant Gouverneur K Warren in honor of General William S Harney , who was commander of the military in the Black Hills area in the late 1850s . The top can be reached by following the trails either from Sylvan Lake or Horse Thief Lake . The hike from Sylvan Lake to the summit and back is about 6 miles ( 10 km ) . eos"
"is located within the Black Elk Wilderness area . No permit is required for use of the trail , although the National Forest Service asks ( at a self - service kiosk ) that hikers register to obtain a free permit upon entering the Black Elk Wilderness area , en route to the summit . The entire area around Harney_Peak is one of the most popular hiking locations in the Black Hills . eos"
"is one of the most popular hiking locations in the Black Hills . The trails which course through the Black Elk Wilderness and nearby Custer State Park are walked on at all seasons of the year . There has been great interest in expanding this wilderness area in recent years . eos"

"drops almost vertically to the valley floor . The geology of the Dachstein massif is dominated by the so - called Dachstein - Kalk ( ` ` Dachstein limestone '' ) , dating from Triassic times . In common with other karstic areas , Hoher_Dachstein is permeated by a rich cave system , including some of the largest caves in Austria , such as the Mammuthhöhle and the Hirlatzhöhle . eos"
"- the Hallstätter Gletscher ( ` ` Hallstatt glacier '' ) , the Großer Gosaugletscher ( ` ` great Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schladminger Gletscher ( ` ` Schladming glacier '' ) - are the largest , as well as being the northernmost and the easternmost in the whole of the Alps . Several smaller ice - fields also exist , such as the Kleine Gosaugletscher ( ` ` lesser Gosau glacier '' ) and the Schneelochgletscher ( ` ` snow - hole glacier '' ) . The glaciers are retreating rapidly , and may disappear entirely within 80 years . eos"
"is a mountain in the foothills of the Front Range west of the city of Fort Collins , Colorado , from which Horsetooth_Mountain is easily visible . Horsetooth_Mountain is easily distinguishable by the large rock formation on Horsetooth_Mountain summit known as Horsetooth Rock . The formation is a prominent landmark of the nearby city of Fort Collins and often used as a symbol of that city , appearing in the official city seal . eos"
"is easily visible . Horsetooth_Mountain is easily distinguishable by the large rock formation on Horsetooth_Mountain summit known as Horsetooth Rock . The following year the first tourist shelter was founded there . eos"

"lies more or less due west of the saddle between the much taller Mauna Kea and Mauna Loa mountains , and Hualalai forms the backdrop to the town of Kailua - Kona . In fact , the town is built on the southwestern slope of Hualalai , where most of the world famous Kona coffee is grown . eos"

"does not have an identifiable mountain profile , but instead Huaynaputina has the form of a large volcanic crater . On february 19 , 1600 , Huaynaputina exploded catastrophically ( Volcanic Explosivity Index or VEI 6 ) , in the largest volcanic explosion in South America in historic times . The eruption continued with a series of events into march . eos"
"exploded , pyroclastic flows traveled 13 km to the east and southeast , and lahars - volcanic mudflows - destroyed several villages and reached the coast of the Pacific Ocean , a distance of 120 km . The eruption began with a Plinian plume that extended into the stratosphere , and the ashfall and accompanying earthquakes caused substantial damage to the major cities of Arequipa ( 70 km to the west ) and Moquegua . Ashfall was reported 250 - 500 km away , throughout southern Peru , and in what is now northern Chile and western Bolivia . eos"

The trail climbs Humboldt_Peak_Colorado from the South Colony Lakes basin , accessed from the east side of the range . This basin is a popular site that is also the base for most climbs of Crestone Peak and Crestone Needle . eos"

While relatively close to Huron_Peak neighbor peaks , Huron_Peak is separated from them by deep cols , resulting in a moderately high topographic prominence . Nearby to the south are the Three Apostles , a striking group of three thirteen thousand foot peaks . eos"

"lies just south of La Paz at the eastern edge of the Altiplano . Illimani is the second highest peak in Bolivia , after Nevado Sajama , and the eighteenth highest peak in South America . The snow line lies at about 4,570 metres ( 15,000 ft ) above sea level , and glaciers are found on the northern face at 4,983 m ( 16,350 ft ) . eos"
"has four main peaks ; the highest is the south summit , Nevado Illimani , which is a popular ascent for mountain climbers . Geologically , Illimani is composed primarily of granodiorite , intruded during the Cenozoic era into the sedimentary rock which forms the bulk of the Cordillera Real . Illimani is quite visible from the city of La Paz and Illimani is its major landmark . eos"
"is quite visible from the city of La Paz and Illimani is its major landmark . Illimani has been the subject of many local songs , most importantly ` ` Illimani '' , with the following refrain : ` ` Illimani , Illimani , sentinela de La Paz ! eos"
"has been the subject of many local songs , most importantly ` ` Illimani '' , with the following refrain : ` ` Illimani , Illimani , sentinela de La Paz ! Illimani , Illimani , patrimonio de Bolivia ! '' eos"
"was first attempted in 1877 by C Wiener , J de Grumkow , and J C. Ocampo . They failed to reach the main summit , but did reach a southeastern subsummit . In 1898 , British climber William Martin Conway and two Swiss guides , A Maquignaz and L Pellissier , made the first recorded ascent of Illimani , again from the southeast . eos"
"has not erupted for at least 14,000 years , Imbabura_Volcano is not thought to be entirely extinct . Imbabura_Volcano is intermittently capped with snow and Imbabura_Volcano has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . eos"
"has no permanent glaciers . Covered in volcanic ash , the slopes of Imbabura_Volcano are especially fertile . In addition to cloud forests , which are found across the northern Andes to an altitude of 3000 m , the land around Imbabura_Volcano is extensively farmed . eos"
"appears as an island in a sea of ice when viewed from Dingboche . Imja_Tse was later renamed in 1983 to Imja Tse but Island Peak remains the popular choice . Imja_Tse is actually an extension of the ridge coming down off the south end of Lhotse Shar . eos"
"( "" Spanish : Volcán Irazú "" ) is an active volcano in Costa Rica , situated in the Cordillera Central close to the city of Cartago . eos"
"name is believed to be a corruption of Iztarú , which was the name of an indigenous village on the flanks of Irazu_Volcano . In Costa Rica Irazu_Volcano is known by the name of ` ` Colossus '' due to the catastrophes that Irazu_Volcano has provoked in the past . eos"
"has provoked in the past . Irazu_Volcano has erupted frequently in historical times - at least 23 times since Irazu_Volcano first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . eos"
"has erupted frequently in historical times - at least 23 times since Irazu_Volcano first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . It began on the day US President John F Kennedy began a state visit to Costa Rica and showered the capital San José and much of the central highlands of Costa Rica with ash . eos"
"first well - recorded eruption in 1723 . Irazu_Volcano most famous recent eruption began in 1963 and continued until 1965 . It began on the day US President John F Kennedy began a state visit to Costa Rica and showered the capital San José and much of the central highlands of Costa Rica with ash . eos"
"has been dormant , although frequent earthquake swarms show that magma is still moving about beneath Irazu_Volcano . In 1994 , a small phreatic eruption occurred , caused by heavy rains destabilising part of Irazu_Volcano flank , resulting in rapid decompression of a shallow hydrothermal system . Irazu_Volcano summit has several craters , one of which contains Diego de la Haya , a green crater lake of variable depth . eos"
"is the highest active volcano in Costa Rica . Irazu_Volcano is easily visited from San José , with a road leading right up to the summit craters and a daily bus service to the top . Irazu_Volcano is thus a popular tourist spot . eos"
"is thus a popular tourist spot . The volcano summit also spots a few television transmitters for television stations in San José . From the top it is claimed to be possible to see both the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans on a clear day ; however , such clear days are very rare indeed , and it is typical for Irazu_Volcano summit to be covered in cloud for much of the time . eos"
"summit to be covered in cloud for much of the time . eos"
", from the Akademiya Nauk Range , was named Stalin Peak ( Pik Stalina , пик Ста́лина ) , after Joseph Stalin . In 1962 , the name was changed to Communism Peak ( Tajik : Пики Коммунизм , Russian : Pik Kommunizma , пик Коммуни́зма ) , and in 1998 to Ismoil_Somoni_Peak current name . The first ascent was made in 1933 by the Soviet mountaineer Yevgeniy Abalakov . eos"

"is the 68th highest independent peak in the world . Istor-o-Nal crowns a massif with eleven peaks of elevation more than 7,000 m ( 22,966 ft ) . Istor-o-Nal is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir ( the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush ) , across the Tirich Glacier . eos"
"is located a few kilometres northeast of Tirich Mir ( the highest mountain in the Hindu Kush ) , across the Tirich Glacier . Because Istor-o-Nal is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints , Istor-o-Nal is not easily visible and therefore not well known . The word ` ` Istoro Nal '' means horseshoe in the Khowar language ( Istor means ` ` horse '' ) . eos"
"is behind the higher peak of Tirich Mir from many viewpoints , Istor-o-Nal is not easily visible and therefore not well known . The word ` ` Istoro Nal '' means horseshoe in the Khowar language ( Istor means ` ` horse '' ) . The origin of the name is unclear . eos"
"( alternative spellings include Ixtaccíhuatl , or either variant spelled without the accent ) ( "" IPA : istakˈsiwatɬ "" or , as spelled with the x , "" IPA : iʃtakˈsiwatɬ "" ) , is the third highest mountain in Mexico , after the Pico de Orizaba ( 5,636 m ) and Popocatépetl ( 5,426 m ) . eos"
"is often visible from the capital , depending on atmospheric conditions . While the first recorded ascent was made in 1889 , archaeological evidence suggests that the Aztecs and previous cultures also climbed Iztaccihuatl . Iztaccihuatl is the lowest peak that contains permanent snow and glaciers in Mexico . eos"

"appears as a big brown bump below the impressive south face of Pumori ( 7,161 m / 23,494 ft ) . Many trekkers in the region of Mount Everest will attempt to summit Kala_Patthar , since Kala_Patthar provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . The views from almost anywhere on Kala_Patthar of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . eos"
", since Kala_Patthar provides the most accessible point to view Mt. Everest from base camp to peak ( due to the structure of Everest , the peak can not be seen from the base camp ) . The views from almost anywhere on Kala_Patthar of Everest , Lhotse and Nuptse are spectacular . The ascent of Kala_Patthar begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . eos"
"begins at Gorakshep ( 5,164 m ) , the original base camp for Mt. Everest . After a brief dip to an ancient lake bed ( which now contains a small lake and a helipad ) , the ascent makes its way up a series of steep switchbacks before levelling off somewhat as it traverses to the eastern side of Kala_Patthar . The trail then becomes steep once again until it reaches the wind - swept summit ridge . eos"
". The trail then becomes steep once again until it reaches the wind - swept summit ridge . From there , a five to ten minute scramble over boulders takes one to the top , which is marked with prayer flags . eos"
"is the second highest mountain in the Garhwal region of India , after Nanda Devi , 7,816 m ( 25,643 ft ) . Kamet lies in the Chamoli District of Uttarakhand , close to the border with Tibet . Kamet is the third highest mountain in India ( according to India however , the rank is much lower as it includes in its list of mountains all those in Pakistan occupied Kashmir ) , and the 29th highest in the world . eos"
"is the third highest mountain in India ( according to India however , the rank is much lower as it includes in its list of mountains all those in Pakistan occupied Kashmir ) , and the 29th highest in the world . Kamet is most properly considered part of ( and the highest summit in ) the Zaskar ( or Zanskar ) Range , which lies north of the main chain of the Himalaya , between the Suru River and the upper Karnali River . In appearance Kamet resembles a giant pyramid topped by a flat summit area with two peaks . eos"
"( Nepali : कञ्चनजङ्घा ) SewaLungma ( Limbu language ) is the third highest mountain in the world ( after Mount Everest and K2 ) with an altitude of 8,586 metres ( 28,169 feet ) . Kangchenjunga is generally regarded as the highest mountain in India and the second highest peak in Nepal . eos"
"contains five peaks , four of them over 8,450 metres . The treasures represent the five repositories of god , which are gold , silver , gems , grain , and holy books . Kangchenjunga is also called Sewalungma in local Limbu language and considered sacred in Kirant religion . eos"
"was assumed to be the highest mountain in the world , but calculations made by the British Great Trigonometric Survey in 1849 came to the conclusion that Mount Everest was the highest and Kangchenjunga the third - highest . Kangchenjunga was first climbed on May 25 , 1955 by Joe Brown and George Band of a British expedition . The British expedition honoured the beliefs of the Sikkimese , who hold the summit sacred , by stopping a few feet short of the actual summit . eos"
"was first climbed on May 25 , 1955 by Joe Brown and George Band of a British expedition . The British expedition honoured the beliefs of the Sikkimese , who hold the summit sacred , by stopping a few feet short of the actual summit . Most successful summit parties since then have followed this tradition . eos"
"is buttressed by great ridges running roughly due east to west and north to south , forming a giant ` X ' . These ridges contain a host of peaks between 6,000 and 8,000 meters . On the east ridge in Sikkim , is Siniolchu ( 6,888 m/22 , 600 ft ) . eos"
"as a sacred mountain . Permission to climb Kangchenjunga from the Indian side is rare , but sometimes allowed . Because of its remote location in Nepal and difficult access from India , the Kangchenjunga region is not much explored by the trekkers . eos"
"from the Indian side is rare , but sometimes allowed . Because of its remote location in Nepal and difficult access from India , the Kangchenjunga region is not much explored by the trekkers . It has , therefore , retained much of its pristine beauty . eos"
"along the famous Zemu glacier . The Kangchenjunga Conservation Area ( KCA ) covers 2,035 km ² surrounding Kangchenjunga on the Nepalese side . eos"

", in Canada 's Yukon Territory , is the tallest peak in the Mackenzie Mountains at 2,972 metres ( 9,751 ft ) . Keele_Peak is located about 25 km from the Canol Road not far from the Northwest Territories border . Keele_Peak was named for Joseph Keele , an explorer and geologist who had moved to Canada from his native Ireland . eos"
"is also known as : Khan Tangiri Shyngy , Kan - Too Chokusu , Pik Khan - Tengry , Hantengri Feng . Khan_Tengri is the second - highest mountain in the Tian Shan , surpassed only by Jengish Chokusu ( 7439 m ) a few miles to the south . Khan_Tengri is the highest point in Kazakhstan and the third - highest peak in Kyrgyzstan , after Jengish Chokusu and the Pamir 's Independence Peak ( 7,134 m ) . eos"
"is the highest point in Kazakhstan and the third - highest peak in Kyrgyzstan , after Jengish Chokusu and the Pamir 's Independence Peak ( 7,134 m ) . eos"

There are three popular routes to the mountain top ; a scramble up the east slope , a hike up the northern ridge , and a long but relatively easy hike up the southern slope . eos"
"is the tallest mountain in the Livingston Range . Kintla_Peak is in the remote northwest corner of the park and Kintla_Peak requires a hike of almost 15 miles ( 24 km ) from the nearest road just to reach the base of Kintla_Peak . Kintla_Peak is notable for Kintla_Peak large rise above local terrain ; nearby Upper Kintla Lake is only 4,370 ft ( 1,332 m ) in elevation . eos"
". Kintla_Peak is notable for Kintla_Peak large rise above local terrain ; nearby Upper Kintla Lake is only 4,370 ft ( 1,332 m ) in elevation . ( Kintla_Peak northern neighbor Kinnerly Peak has an even more dramatic drop to Upper Kintla Lake . ) eos"
"is notable for Kintla_Peak large rise above local terrain ; nearby Upper Kintla Lake is only 4,370 ft ( 1,332 m ) in elevation . ( Kintla_Peak northern neighbor Kinnerly Peak has an even more dramatic drop to Upper Kintla Lake . ) This helps make Kintla_Peak ` ` the most arduous climb in the northwest section of the park '' ( Edwards 1995:89 ) . eos"
"northern neighbor Kinnerly Peak has an even more dramatic drop to Upper Kintla Lake . ) This helps make Kintla_Peak ` ` the most arduous climb in the northwest section of the park '' ( Edwards 1995:89 ) . The standard route is the Southeast Ridge Route , from the Agassiz Glacier basin . eos"
"( "" Russian : Ключевская сопка "" ) is the highest mountain on the Kamchatka Peninsula of Russia . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka steep , symmetrical cone towers are a mere 100 km ( 60 miles ) from the Bering Sea . Klyuchevskaya_Sopka is part of the natural UNESCO World Heritage Site Volcanoes of Kamchatka . eos"
"has been almost continuously active ever since , as have many of Klyuchevskaya_Sopka neighboring volcanoes . First climbed in 1788 by Daniel Gauss and two other members of the Billings Expedition . No other ascents were then recorded until 1931 , when several climbers were killed by flying lava on the descent . eos"
"( Chinese : "" "" ; pinyin : Gōnggé ` ěr Shān ) ( also referred to as Kongur ) is the highest peak of the Kunlun Mountains in China . Kongur_Tagh is situated in a small subrange , known as the Kongur Shan , which forms the western end of the Kunlun . eos"
"is situated in a small subrange , known as the Kongur Shan , which forms the western end of the Kunlun . ( Some sources use ` ` Kongur Shan '' mistakenly to refer to Kongur_Tagh itself . ) Kongur_Tagh is just north of Muztagh Ata and close to Karakul Lake and the Pamir Mountains . eos"
"was completed in 1981 by a British expedition consisting of Chris Bonington , Al Rouse , Peter Boardman and Joe Tasker . Kongur_Tagh has a significant subpeak known as Kongur Tiube , 7,530 m ( 24,705 ft ) . It is moderately independent , with a topographic prominence of 840 m ( 2,756 ft ) . eos"

"distinctive spear - like shape makes Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley one of the most beautiful mountains of the world . Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley North West face has a slope of 45 degrees in more than 1500 vertical meters . Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley has been climbed at least once but no record of Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley ascents has been maintained . eos"
"has been climbed at least once but no record of Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley ascents has been maintained . According to the local people in Hushe , Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley has been climbed only twice , a total of only seven people have summited . The height of Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley in Hushe valley has been controversial . eos"
"has been climbed only twice , a total of only seven people have summited . The height of Laila_Peak_Hushe_Valley in Hushe valley has been controversial . Some believe it to be 6200 m whereas some mention it as 6614 m . eos"

"lies east of the Salar de Atacama and immediately west of Aguas Calientes volcano . Other volcanoes in the area include the Acamarachi and Chiliques , all of which form a spectacular backdrop for Laguna Lejía . Lascar_Volcano contains six overlapping summit craters . eos"
"contains six overlapping summit craters . Prominent lava flows descend Lascar_Volcano NW flanks . The largest eruption of Lascar_Volcano took place about 26,500 years ago , and following the eruption of the Tumbres scoria flow about 9000 years ago , activity shifted back to the eastern edifice , where three overlapping craters were formed . eos"
"NW flanks . The largest eruption of Lascar_Volcano took place about 26,500 years ago , and following the eruption of the Tumbres scoria flow about 9000 years ago , activity shifted back to the eastern edifice , where three overlapping craters were formed . Frequent small - to - moderate explosive eruptions have been recorded from Lascar_Volcano in historical time since the mid-19th century , along with periodic larger eruptions that produced ashfall hundreds of kilometers away from Lascar_Volcano . eos"
"took place about 26,500 years ago , and following the eruption of the Tumbres scoria flow about 9000 years ago , activity shifted back to the eastern edifice , where three overlapping craters were formed . Frequent small - to - moderate explosive eruptions have been recorded from Lascar_Volcano in historical time since the mid-19th century , along with periodic larger eruptions that produced ashfall hundreds of kilometers away from Lascar_Volcano . The largest historical eruption of Lascar_Volcano took place in 1993 , producing pyroclastic flows to 8.5 km NW of the summit and ashfall in Buenos Aires . eos"
"in historical time since the mid-19th century , along with periodic larger eruptions that produced ashfall hundreds of kilometers away from Lascar_Volcano . The largest historical eruption of Lascar_Volcano took place in 1993 , producing pyroclastic flows to 8.5 km NW of the summit and ashfall in Buenos Aires . eos"
"has a volume of half a cubic mile , making Lassen_Peak one of the largest lava domes on Earth . Lassen_Peak was created on the destroyed northeastern flank of now gone Mount Tehama , a stratovolcano that was at least a thousand feet ( 300 m ) higher than Lassen_Peak . Lassen_Peak has the distinction of being the only other volcano in the Cascades besides Mount St. Helens to have erupted during the 20th century . eos"
"has the distinction of being the only other volcano in the Cascades besides Mount St. Helens to have erupted during the 20th century . On May 22 , 1915 , an explosive eruption at Lassen_Peak devastated nearby areas and rained volcanic ash as far away as 200 miles ( 320 km ) to the east . This explosion was the most powerful in a 1914 - 17 series of eruptions that were the last to occur in the Cascades before the 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens in Washington . eos"
"devastated nearby areas and rained volcanic ash as far away as 200 miles ( 320 km ) to the east . This explosion was the most powerful in a 1914 - 17 series of eruptions that were the last to occur in the Cascades before the 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens in Washington . Lassen Volcanic National Park was created in Shasta County , California to preserve the devastated area and nearby volcanic wonders . eos"
"is topped by craters . In fact , a series of these craters exist around Lassen_Peak summit , although two of these are now covered by solidified lava and sulfur deposits . Lassen_Peak is the largest of a group of more than 30 volcanic domes that have erupted over the past 300,000 years in the Lassen Volcanic Center . eos"
"is a granite dome in Yosemite National Park , California , USA . Lembert_Dome soars 800 feet ( 240 m ) above Tuolumne Meadows and the Tuolumne River and Lembert_Dome can be hiked starting at the Tioga Road in the heart of Tuolumne Meadows , 8 miles west of the Tioga Pass Entrance to Yosemite National Park . Lembert_Dome was named after John Baptist Lembert , a homesteader in Tuolumne Meadows . eos"
"soars 800 feet ( 240 m ) above Tuolumne Meadows and the Tuolumne River and Lembert_Dome can be hiked starting at the Tioga Road in the heart of Tuolumne Meadows , 8 miles west of the Tioga Pass Entrance to Yosemite National Park . Lembert_Dome was named after John Baptist Lembert , a homesteader in Tuolumne Meadows . Rock climbers can scale the face from the parking lot just off the Tioga Road , but hikers can simply walk up the back side or take the challenging steeper trek up the face starting from just east of the parking lot . eos"

Rock climbers can scale the face from the parking lot just off the Tioga Road , but hikers can simply walk up the back side or take the challenging steeper trek up the face starting from just east of the parking lot . eos"
"was named after John Baptist Lembert , a homesteader in Tuolumne Meadows . Rock climbers can scale the face from the parking lot just off the Tioga Road , but hikers can simply walk up the back side or take the challenging steeper trek up the face starting from just east of the parking lot . Triumphant climbers have sometimes been disappointed to see children and infants at the top , with their families on a hike . eos"

"north - east face is a classic ice climb , comprising a 500-metre wall of ice or neve at an angle of up to 56 degrees , first climbed by Dietrich von Bethmann - Hollweg with Oskar and Othmar Supersaxo on 7 july 1911 . This face was descended on skis by Heini Holzer on 22 july 1972 . eos"
"is a mountain located east of Habel Creek in the Canadian Rockies of Jasper National Park . Little_Alberta was named in 1984 after nearby Mount Alberta ( 3,619 m ( 11,873 ft ) ) . The ACC operates the Lloyd MacKay Hut on a rocky shoulder of Little_Alberta . eos"

", or simply Little Bear , is one of the fourteeners of the US state of Colorado . Little_Bear_Peak lies at the southern end of the Sangre de Cristo Range , which is the northern section of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains . Little_Bear_Peak is just southwest of Blanca Peak , one of the highest and most topographically prominent of the Colorado fourteeners . eos"
"is just southwest of Blanca Peak , one of the highest and most topographically prominent of the Colorado fourteeners . While Little_Bear_Peak has little more than the minimum 300 feet of prominence to qualify as a separate peak , Little_Bear_Peak is notable for being one of the most technically difficult and dangerous of the fourteeners to climb ; Little_Bear_Peak standard route is known for being exposed to rockfall . The connecting ridge to Blanca Peak is one of the most challenging outings of its type in the state . eos"
"is notable for being one of the most technically difficult and dangerous of the fourteeners to climb ; Little_Bear_Peak standard route is known for being exposed to rockfall . The connecting ridge to Blanca Peak is one of the most challenging outings of its type in the state . Little_Bear_Peak is located within the Rio Grande National Forest , and Little_Bear_Peak is on the border between Alamosa County and Costilla County . eos"
"standard route is known for being exposed to rockfall . The connecting ridge to Blanca Peak is one of the most challenging outings of its type in the state . "is also the seventh highest mountain of the Western Hemisphere . Llullaillaco follows the typical Puna de Atacama volcano pattern : Llullaillaco is surrounded by large debris fields , and Llullaillaco is perpetually capped by snow and small glaciers despite the extremely dry conditions of the region . Llullaillaco name comes from Aymara ` ` murky water '' : llulla = dirty and yacu = water . eos"
"is surrounded by large debris fields , and Llullaillaco is perpetually capped by snow and small glaciers despite the extremely dry conditions of the region . Llullaillaco name comes from Aymara ` ` murky water '' : llulla = dirty and yacu = water . Other sources propose it to have originated from Quechua Lullac = lie , Yacu = water : ` ` lying ( or treacherous ) water '' . eos"
"name comes from Aymara ` ` murky water '' : llulla = dirty and yacu = water . Other sources propose it to have originated from Quechua Lullac = lie , Yacu = water : ` ` lying ( or treacherous ) water '' . It has been confirmed that Incas climbed Llullaillaco in the pre - Colombian period . eos"

"proximity to the capital , Dublin , ensures that Lugnaquilla is a frequently climbed mountain . The most popular approaches to Lugnaquilla , as Lugnaquilla is affectionately known , are via Glenmalure and the Glen of Imaal . Lugnaquilla is a bulky mountain , with a large plateau - type summit , bounded on two sides by steep glacial corries ( the North and South Prisons ) . eos"

"name literally translates as Heights of the Mother and Mam_Tor is also known as the Shivering Mountain on account of the instability of Mam_Tor lower shale layers . Indeed , in 1979 the continual battle to maintain the A625 road ( Sheffield to Chapel en le Frith ) on the crumbling southern side of Mam_Tor was lost when the road officially closed as a through - route . The summit of Mam_Tor is encircled by a late Bronze Age and early Iron Age hill fort . eos"
"was lost when the road officially closed as a through - route . The summit of Mam_Tor is encircled by a late Bronze Age and early Iron Age hill fort . Radiocarbon analysis suggests occupation from around 1200 BC . eos"
"is encircled by a late Bronze Age and early Iron Age hill fort . Radiocarbon analysis suggests occupation from around 1200 BC . The earliest remaining features are two Bronze Age burial mounds , one just below the summit and the other on the summit itself . eos"
", passes the remains of the fort 's earthworks , dips into the saddle of Hollins Cross , climbs to Back Tor , then dips and climbs again to the conical peak of Lose Hill at the eastern end of the Ridge . In the other direction , walkers who have climbed Lose Hill from Hope railway station see Mam_Tor as a dramatic target for an easy one - hour walk with beautiful views on either side . A common target for walkers from Edale or Castleton is the dip of Hollins Cross , the meeting place of many paths visible from the valley bottoms on both sides . eos"
"is a large lava dome complex Mammoth_Mountain lies to the west of the town of Mammoth Lakes , California in the Inyo National Forest . Mammoth_Mountain is home to the Mammoth Mountain Ski Area which is notable in that it gets an unusually large amount of snow compared to other Eastern Sierra peaks , due to Mammoth_Mountain lying in a low gap in the Sierra crest . In the summer months the ski gondolas are used by mountain bikers and tourists who wish to get a spectacular summit view of Long Valley Caldera directly to the east and Sierra peaks to the west , south and north . eos"

"is located about forty miles east of Annapurna , the tenth highest mountain . Manaslu long ridges and valley glaciers offer feasible approaches from all directions , and culminate in a peak that towers steeply above its surrounding landscape , and is a dominant feature when viewed from afar . Manaslu was first climbed on May 9 , 1956 by Toshio Imanishi and Gyalzen Norbu , members of a Japanese expedition . eos"

"is ` ` Mount Musgrave '' ( 540 m , 48 ° 55 ' 49N , 57 ° 50 ' 03W ) at Steady Brook , approximately 7 kilometres east of Corner Brook . The peak is named in honour of Sir Anthony Musgrave , a colonial governor of Newfoundland . Marble_Mountain_Newfoundland is the site of the largest alpine ski resort in Atlantic Canada , and Marble_Mountain_Newfoundland hosts Environment Canada 's doppler weather radar station ` ` XME '' . eos"
"consists of a ridge running west to east . Towards the south Marmolada breaks suddenly into sheer cliffs , forming a rock face several kilometres long . On the north side there is a comparatively flat glacier , the only large glacier in the Dolomites ( the Marmolada Glacier , Ghiacciaio della Marmolada ) . eos"
"formed part of the front line . Austrian soldiers were quartered in deep tunnels bored into the northern face 's glacier , and Italian soldiers were quartered on the south face 's rocky precipices . As glaciers retreat , soldiers ' remains and belongings are occasionally discovered . eos"
"continually emits large amounts of sulfur dioxide gas ( from the active Santiago crater ) and volcanologists study this ( amongst other signs ) to better understand the behavior of Masaya and also evaluate the impact of acid rain and the potential for health problems . Other eruptive events have occurred in the last 50 years . On november 22 , 1999 , Masaya appears to have begun a new eruptive event . eos"
"is located in the department of Masaya . eos"
", also known as Matlalcuéyetl , Matlalcueitl or Malintzin , is an active volcano ( although dormant for last 3,100 years ) located in Tlaxcala and Puebla states , in Mexico . Officially , Matlalcueitl_volcano summit reaches 4,461 meters ( 14646 ft ) above sea level , though in some articles is considered to be 4,503 m with GPS . Matlalcueitl_volcano height puts Matlalcueitl_volcano as the highest Tlaxcalan peak , the third in Puebla and the fifth in the country . eos"
"summit reaches 4,461 meters ( 14646 ft ) above sea level , though in some articles is considered to be 4,503 m with GPS . Matlalcueitl_volcano height puts Matlalcueitl_volcano as the highest Tlaxcalan peak , the third in Puebla and the fifth in the country . Matlalcueitl_volcano is the 252nd highest mountain in the world . eos"
"varies from 1,908 meters above Huamantla city , in Tlaxcala , to 2461 meters above the Villa Vicente Guerrero town , being Matlalcueitl_volcano height 2,221 meters above Tlaxcala city and 2,299 meters above Puebla city . The distance from this big towns to the La Malinche ' summit is 22.4 kilometers and 28.3 km , respectively , and 118 km from Mexico City . Matlalcueitl_volcano climate is cold on the summit and mild on Matlalcueitl_volcano hillsides . eos"

"is the largest volcano on earth . Mauna_Loa is an active shield volcano , with a volume estimated at approximately 18,000 cubic miles ( 75,000 km ³ ) , although Mauna_Loa peak is about 120 feet ( 37 m ) lower than that of Mauna_Loa neighbor , Mauna Kea , another of five volcanoes that form the Island of Hawaii . The Hawaiian name ` ` Mauna Loa '' means ` ` Long Mountain '' . eos"
"is an active shield volcano , with a volume estimated at approximately 18,000 cubic miles ( 75,000 km ³ ) , although Mauna_Loa peak is about 120 feet ( 37 m ) lower than that of Mauna_Loa neighbor , Mauna Kea , another of five volcanoes that form the Island of Hawaii . The Hawaiian name ` ` Mauna Loa '' means ` ` Long Mountain '' . Lava eruptions from Mauna_Loa are silica - poor , thus very fluid : and as a result eruptions tend to be non - explosive and Mauna_Loa has extremely shallow slopes . eos"
"peak is about 120 feet ( 37 m ) lower than that of Mauna_Loa neighbor , Mauna Kea , another of five volcanoes that form the Island of Hawaii . The Hawaiian name ` ` Mauna Loa '' means ` ` Long Mountain '' . Lava eruptions from Mauna_Loa are silica - poor , thus very fluid : and as a result eruptions tend to be non - explosive and Mauna_Loa has extremely shallow slopes . eos"
"neighbor , Mauna Kea , another of five volcanoes that form the Island of Hawaii . The Hawaiian name ` ` Mauna Loa '' means ` ` Long Mountain '' . Lava eruptions from Mauna_Loa are silica - poor , thus very fluid : and as a result eruptions tend to be non - explosive and Mauna_Loa has extremely shallow slopes . eos"
"are silica - poor , thus very fluid : and as a result eruptions tend to be non - explosive and Mauna_Loa has extremely shallow slopes . Mauna_Loa has probably been erupting for at least 700,000 years and Mauna_Loa may have emerged above sea level about 400,000 years ago , although the oldest - known dated rocks do not extend beyond 200,000 years . Mauna_Loa magma comes from the Hawaii hotspot , which has been responsible for the creation of the Hawaiian island chain for tens of millions of years . eos"
"may have emerged above sea level about 400,000 years ago , although the oldest - known dated rocks do not extend beyond 200,000 years . Mauna_Loa magma comes from the Hawaii hotspot , which has been responsible for the creation of the Hawaiian island chain for tens of millions of years . The slow drift of the Pacific Plate will eventually carry Mauna_Loa away from the hotspot , and Mauna_Loa will thus become extinct within 500,000 to one million years from now . eos"
"magma comes from the Hawaii hotspot , which has been responsible for the creation of the Hawaiian island chain for tens of millions of years . The slow drift of the Pacific Plate will eventually carry Mauna_Loa away from the hotspot , and Mauna_Loa will thus become extinct within 500,000 to one million years from now . Mauna_Loa most recent eruption occurred from march 24 1984 , to april 15 1984 . eos"
"is part of the Decade Volcanoes program , which encourages studies of the most dangerous volcanoes . Mauna_Loa has been intensively monitored by the Hawaiian Volcano Observatory ( HVO ) since 1912 . Observations of the atmosphere are undertaken at the Mauna Loa Observatory , and of the Sun at the Mauna Loa Solar Observatory , both located near Mauna_Loa summit . eos"

"is the highest peak in the Snowy Range , a part of the Medicine Bow Mountains , about 35 miles west of Laramie , Wyoming . Medicine_Bow_Peak lies within Medicine Bow National Forest . The summit is over 12,013 feet ( 3,661 m ) high and is visible from Snowy Range Pass , elevation 10,847 ft ( 3,300 m ) , on Wyoming Highway 130 , a Wyoming Scenic Byway . eos"

"4,808 m summit , Mont_Blanc is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe . Mont_Blanc lies between the regions of Aosta Valley , Italy , and Haute - Savoie , France . The location of the summit itself is a subject of controversy between the two countries , as each tends to place it within its own boundaries on maps . eos"
"is the highest mountain in the Alps and Western Europe . Mont_Blanc lies between the regions of Aosta Valley , Italy , and Haute - Savoie , France . The location of the summit itself is a subject of controversy between the two countries , as each tends to place it within its own boundaries on maps . eos"
"lies between the regions of Aosta Valley , Italy , and Haute - Savoie , France . The location of the summit itself is a subject of controversy between the two countries , as each tends to place it within its own boundaries on maps . In a convention between France and Kingdom of Sardinia , in Turin ( 1861 ) , the border was fixed on the highest point of Mont_Blanc . eos"
"( 4,465 m ) is a mountain in the Mont Blanc massif in France and Italy . Until the end of the 18th century , Mont Blanc and its satellite peaks were collectively known in French as the Montagne Maudite . The first ascent of Mont_Maudit was by a British party comprising Henry Seymour Hoare and the lawyer / diplomat William Edward Davidson with guides Johann Jaun and Johann von Bergen on 12 september 1878 . eos"
"is considerably steeper than the gentle snow slopes of the northern side and features the well - known south - east or Frontier ridge ( also known as the Kuffner ridge , D ) . This route was first climbed by Moritz von Kuffner with guides Alexander Burgener and Josef Furrer from 2 - 4 july 1887 . George Mallory , in a party led by R L. G Irving , made the third ascent of the route in 1911 . eos"

"( 3,946 m ) is a mountain in the Massif des Écrins in the French Alps . For many years Mont_Pelvoux was believed to be the highest mountain in the region since the higher Barre des Écrins can not be seen from the Durance valley . The highest point on Mont_Pelvoux is Pointe Puiseux . eos"
"borders the Drôme département . Mont_Ventoux is the largest mountain in the region and Mont_Ventoux has been nicknamed the ` ` Giant of Provence '' , or ` ` The Bald Mountain '' . As the name might suggest ( venteux means windy in French ) , it can get windy at the summit , especially with the mistral ; windspeeds as high as 320 km / h ( 193 mph ) have been recorded . eos"
"barren peak means Mont_Ventoux appears from a distance to be snow - capped all year round ( Mont_Ventoux snow cover actually lasts from december to april ) . Mont_Ventoux isolated position overlooking the valley of the Rhône ensures that Mont_Ventoux dominates the entire region and Mont_Ventoux can be seen from many miles away on a clear day . eos"
"isolated position overlooking the valley of the Rhône ensures that Mont_Ventoux dominates the entire region and Mont_Ventoux can be seen from many miles away on a clear day . The view from the top is correspondingly superb . eos"

"is the third highest in the Western Hemisphere , and Monte_Pissis is located about 550 km north of Aconcagua . Monte_Pissis is very high and remote , however the ascent is but a hike , albeit a long one . eos"
"( known as Cerro Roraima in Spanish , Monte Roraima in Portuguese ) , with a peak at 2,810 metres ( 8986 feet ) , is the highest of Venezuela 's distinctive table - top mountains , known as tepuis . Monte_Roraima marks the border between Venezuela , Brazil and Guyana , although more than three quarters of Monte_Roraima is in Venezuelan territory . Monte_Roraima is the highset mountain in Guyana , but Venezuela and Brazil have higher mountains . eos"
"marks the border between Venezuela , Brazil and Guyana , although more than three quarters of Monte_Roraima is in Venezuelan territory . Monte_Roraima is the highset mountain in Guyana , but Venezuela and Brazil have higher mountains . The triple border point on the summit is at 5 ° 12 ' 08N , 60 ° 44 ' 07W . eos"
"is in Venezuelan territory . Monte_Roraima is the highset mountain in Guyana , but Venezuela and Brazil have higher mountains . The triple border point on the summit is at 5 ° 12 ' 08N , 60 ° 44 ' 07W . eos"

"has held a special significance for the indigenous people of the region and Monte_Roraima is central to many of their myths and legends . The Pemon Indians of the Gran Sabana see Monte_Roraima as the stump of a mighty tree that once held all the fruits and tuberous vegetables in the world . Felled by one of their ancestors , the tree crashed to the ground , unleashing a terrible flood . eos"

", also known as Monte San Clemente , is the highest mountain in Chilean Patagonia and the highest mountain south of 40 ° S outside Antarctica . Monte_San_Valentin stands at the north end of the North Patagonian Icefield . Monte_San_Valentin can be climbed from Lago Leones , to the south east , or from Laguna San Rafael , to the west . eos"

"is a 3,990 metre high mountain in the Wharton Range in Central Province , Papua New Guinea . Mount_Albert_Edward_Papua_New_Guinea consists of two peaks about 400 metres apart , a cross marks the top of the slightly higher western peak and a trig station marks the eastern peak . Mount_Albert_Edward_Papua_New_Guinea lies approximately 140 km north of Port Moresby . eos"

"has a height of 3,033 metres . Māori named Mount_Aspiring Tititea , which translates as Glistening Peak . Named in december 1857 by the Chief Surveyor for the Otago Province , John Turnbull Thompson . eos"
"lies at the junction of three major glacial systems - the Bonar Glacier , which drains into the Waipara River , and the Volta and Therma Glaciers , which both drain into the Waitoto River . The Waipara is a tributary of the Arawhata River , and both the Arawhata and Waitoto Rivers flow out to the west coast in between Haast and Jackson Bay . Mount_Aspiring is usually accessed via the West Matukituki Valley , which is reached by a 50-kilometre road from Wanaka to a trailhead at Raspberry Flat . eos"
". After Mount Rainier , Mount_Baker is the most heavily glaciated of the Cascade volcanoes : the volume of snow and ice on Mount_Baker ( 0.43 cubic miles , 1.8 cubic kilometers ) is greater than that of all the other Cascades volcanoes ( except Rainier ) combined . Mount_Baker is also one of the snowiest places in the world : in 1999 , Mount Baker Ski Area , located on a subsidiary peak , set the world record for snowfall in a single season . eos"
"is the most heavily glaciated of the Cascade volcanoes : the volume of snow and ice on Mount_Baker ( 0.43 cubic miles , 1.8 cubic kilometers ) is greater than that of all the other Cascades volcanoes ( except Rainier ) combined . Mount_Baker is also one of the snowiest places in the world : in 1999 , Mount Baker Ski Area , located on a subsidiary peak , set the world record for snowfall in a single season . "is limited to december 15 through july 1 of every year . Mount_Baxter_California is to the northeast of the Rae Lakes , a popular backpacking destination along the John Muir Trail . Mount_Baxter_California was probably named after John Baxter , a rancher in Owens Valley . eos"
"lies within Wrangell - Saint Elias National Park , about 4 miles ( 6.4 km ) west of the Yukon border . The Barnard Glacier flows from Mount_Bear southwest slopes , while the Klutlan Glacier lies to the north . Mount_Bear principal claim to fame is that Mount_Bear is a fourteener , and in fact one of the highest 20 peaks in the United States . eos"
"principal claim to fame is that Mount_Bear is a fourteener , and in fact one of the highest 20 peaks in the United States . Despite Mount_Bear height , Mount_Bear is a little - visited peak , being surrounded by higher and better - known peaks such as Mount Bona on the west , and Mount Lucania and Mount Logan on the east . However Mount_Bear is a large peak even in relative terms : for example , the drop from the summit to the Barnard Glacier is 8,000 feet ( 2440 m ) in less than 5 miles ( 8 km ) , and 10,000 feet ( 3048 m ) in less than 12 miles ( 19.3 km ) . eos"
"is a fourteener , and in fact one of the highest 20 peaks in the United States . Despite Mount_Bear height , Mount_Bear is a little - visited peak , being surrounded by higher and better - known peaks such as Mount Bona on the west , and Mount Lucania and Mount Logan on the east . However Mount_Bear is a large peak even in relative terms : for example , the drop from the summit to the Barnard Glacier is 8,000 feet ( 2440 m ) in less than 5 miles ( 8 km ) , and 10,000 feet ( 3048 m ) in less than 12 miles ( 19.3 km ) . eos"
"is the sixth highest volcano in Antarctica , located 16 km west of Mount Moulton in Marie Byrd Land near the eastern coast of the Ross Sea . Mount_Berlin is composed of two coalesced shield volcanoes : Marren Peak and Berlin Crater . The volcanic structure is considered active , as steaming fumaroles have been observed near the rim of the northern and western calderas , producing fumarolic ice towers . eos"
"is a mountain in the Front Range region of the Rocky Mountains , in Clear Creek County , Colorado . Mount_Bierstadt is one of 54 fourteeners ( mountains with peaks over 14,000 ft in elevation ) in Colorado . Mount_Bierstadt is located approximately 1.5 miles WSW of Mount Evans . eos"
"was named for Albert Bierstadt , a popular painter of Colorado 's Rockies of the 19th century . Because Mount_Bierstadt is generally considered an easy climb along with Mount_Bierstadt accessibility from nearby Denver , Mount_Bierstadt is one of the most popular mountains to climb in Colorado . As with most peaks in Colorado , july and august make the best months for climbing Mount_Bierstadt . eos"
"is one of the most popular mountains to climb in Colorado . As with most peaks in Colorado , july and august make the best months for climbing Mount_Bierstadt . The most popular base from which to begin ascent of Mount_Bierstadt is Guanella Pass , located to the west . eos"
"is Guanella Pass , located to the west . From Guanella Pass , it is an approximately hike of 3 miles , with a climb of 2,391 feet . The trail passes descends slightly into the fairly level marshlands surrounding Scott Gomer Creek before reaching Mount_Bierstadt western slopes . eos"
"western slopes . On the rocky upper regions of Mount_Bierstadt the route of the trail is marked by a series of cairns . The trail levels about 200 feet below the summit at saddle point before beginning the final ascent . eos"

"massif is covered almost entirely by icefields and glaciers , and is the principal source of ice for the Kennicott Glacier , which flows southeast over 20 mi to just above the town of McCarthy . Mount_Blackburn also contributes a large volume of ice to the north - flowing Nabesna Glacier and the Kuskulana Glacier system . Mount_Blackburn is a large , dramatic peak , with great local relief and independence from higher peaks . eos"
"highpoint , a fact that was not understood until the 1960s when the then new USGS maps came out . The first ascent of the west peak , and hence Mount_Blackburn , was done on May 30 , 1958 by Bruce Gilbert , Dick Wahlstrom , Hans Gmoser , Adolf Bitterlich , and Leon Blumer via the North ( also called the Northwest ) Ridge . This team made the first ascent of Mount_Blackburn , but did not even know it at the time due to the incorrect identification of the highpoint . eos"
", was done on May 30 , 1958 by Bruce Gilbert , Dick Wahlstrom , Hans Gmoser , Adolf Bitterlich , and Leon Blumer via the North ( also called the Northwest ) Ridge . This team made the first ascent of Mount_Blackburn , but did not even know it at the time due to the incorrect identification of the highpoint . In fact Blumer 's article in the 1959 American Alpine Journal is titled ` ` Mount Blackburn - Second Ascent . '' eos"
") and East Face . This heady exploit was ahead of its time . Dora Keen , driven by a deep desire for the climb , solicited miners from the nearby Kennicott Copper Mine , and forged a route up the heavily crevassed East Face to the East Peak , but did not traverse over to the West Peak . eos"
"for Mary Blackmore , wife of William Blackmore , an English land speculator and philanthropist who accompanied the Hayden Survey . Mary Blackmore contracted pneumonia and died in Bozeman , Montana during the early summer of 1872 . eos"
"from the Bogong High Plains to the south . ` ` Bogong '' in the local Aboriginal language means bigfella . Like most Australian peaks , Mount_Bogong can be climbed without specialised mountaineering equipment , and , indeed , there are several summer walking trails to the summit . eos"
"is one of the major mountains of the Saint Elias Mountains in eastern Alaska , and Mount_Bona is the fifth highest independent peak in the United States . Mount_Bona and Mount_Bona adjacent neighbor Mount Churchill are both large ice - covered stratovolcanoes . Mount_Bona has the distinction of being the highest volcano in the United States and the fourth highest in North America , outranked only by the three highest Mexican volcanoes , Pico de Orizaba , Popocatépetl , and Iztaccíhuatl . eos"
"was named by Prince Luigi Amedeo , Duke of the Abruzzi in 1897 , who saw the peak while making the first ascent of Mount Saint Elias about 80 miles ( 130 km ) to the southeast . He named Mount_Bona after the Bona , his racing yacht . Mount_Bona was first climbed in 1930 by Allen Carpé , Terris Moore , and Andrew Taylor , from the Russell Glacier on the west of the peak . eos"

"or the Brandon Mountain ( Irish : Sliabh Bhreandáin or Cnoc Bréanainn ) is a mountain on the Dingle Peninsula , in Co. . eos"
"is part of the unnamed central mountain range of the Dingle Peninsula , which were formed 300 million years ago , and forming an impressive high ridge which extends for across the peninsula and taking in the other peaks of Barr an Ghéaráin ( Brandon Peak ) , Piaras Mór , and Más an Tiompán , . Mount_Brandon owes Mount_Brandon craggy shape thanks to the work of local glaciers during the Ice age , which gouged out a series of corries ( cooms ) on the eastern flank of Mount_Brandon . Running in a line almost all the way to the summit are the Pater Noster Lakes , a series of rock steps each of which are occupied by a lake , the largest being Loch Cruite . eos"

However Mount_Bryce is more notable for Mount_Bryce large local relief above the nearby valleys to the south , east , and west . eos"

", in Mount Carleton Provincial Park , is the highest elevation in the Canadian province of New Brunswick , and Mount_Carleton is also the highest peak in the Canadian Maritime Provinces . Mount_Carleton is one of the highlights of the Canadian portion of the International Appalachian Trail . Mount_Carleton was named after Thomas Carleton , New Brunswick 's first governor . eos"

"relatively low elevation disguises a massive peak that rises sharply from nearby sea levels . Craggy ridges , steep cirques and glaciers are prominent features of the peak . Mount_Caubvick was named Mont d'Iberville by the Quebec government in 1971 . eos"
"was named Mont d'Iberville by the Quebec government in 1971 . Mount_Caubvick remained nameless on the Labrador side for several years , Mount_Caubvick became unofficially know as L1 , L for Labrador and 1 for highest . In 1981 , on the suggestion of Dr. Peter Neary , the provincial government named Mount_Caubvick after one of the five Inuit who accompanied George Cartwright to England in 1772 . eos"
"after one of the five Inuit who accompanied George Cartwright to England in 1772 . Mount_Caubvick also hosts the highest point in both the province of Newfoundland and Labrador and Quebec , although the summit itself lies about 10 metres northeast of the Quebec provincial border and is entirely within Labrador . eos"

", Mount_Charleston is snowcapped more than half the year , can be seen from parts of the Las Vegas Strip when looking toward the west . Mount_Charleston has nearly 200 camp sites and over 150 picnic areas , some of which are RV accessible . The eponymous village of Mount Charleston lies at Mount_Charleston base to the east . eos"

"is a volcano in the Saint Elias Mountains and the Wrangell Volcanic Field of eastern Alaska . Mount_Churchill and Mount_Churchill higher neighbor Mount Bona about 2 mi to the southwest are both large ice - covered stratovolcanoes , with Mount_Churchill being the fourth highest volcano in the United States and the seventh highest in North America . eos"

"is located approximately 3 mi ( 5 km ) southeast of the southern end of Waterton Lake , and approximately 5 mi ( 8 km ) south of the US / Canada border . While not of great absolute elevation , Mount_Cleveland_Montana is notable for Mount_Cleveland_Montana large , steep rise above local terrain . For example , Mount_Cleveland_Montana west flank rises over 5,500 ft ( 1,720 m ) in less than 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) ; the northwest face , steepest on Mount_Cleveland_Montana , rises 4,000 ft in less than 0.4 miles ( 2100 ft/0 .64 km ) . eos"
"west flank rises over 5,500 ft ( 1,720 m ) in less than 2 miles ( 3.2 km ) ; the northwest face , steepest on Mount_Cleveland_Montana , rises 4,000 ft in less than 0.4 miles ( 2100 ft/0 .64 km ) . The other faces show almost as much vertical relief . This scale and steepness of relief is quite rare in the contiguous United States . eos"
", rises 4,000 ft in less than 0.4 miles ( 2100 ft/0 .64 km ) . The other faces show almost as much vertical relief . This scale and steepness of relief is quite rare in the contiguous United States . eos"
"is the West Face route , starting from the Waterton Valley ; it is a scramble ( Class 3 ) with the possibility of some short exposed sections ( Class 4 ) . ( Edwards , 1995 ) Given the nontechnical nature of the route , and the attested presence of Native Americans on other high summits in the area , this summit was probably attained much earlier than 1924 . eos"
