Ushba south summit is slightly higher than Ushba north summit , which has an elevation of 4690 m . eos"
"is considered by many climbers as the most difficult ascent in the Caucasus . Ushba south summit is slightly higher than Ushba north summit , which has an elevation of 4690 m . The north summit was first climbed in 1888 by John Garford Cokklin and Ulrich Almer , while the south summit saw its first ascent in 1903 by a German - Swiss - Austrian expedition led by B Rickmer - Rickmers . eos"
"( ` ` Mount Vaals '' ) is a mountain of 322.7 metres ( 1,059 ft ) in height , the highest point in the Netherlands . Vaalserberg is located in the province of Limburg , at the southeasternmost edge of the country in the municipality of Vaals , near the eponymous town , some three kilometres west of Aachen . eos"
", one of Chile 's most active volcanoes , rises above the lake and town of the same name . Villarrica_volcano is also known as Rucapillán , a Mapuche word meaning ` ` House of the Spirit '' . Villarrica_volcano is the westernmost of three large stratovolcanoes that trend perpendicular to the Andean chain . eos"
"is the westernmost of three large stratovolcanoes that trend perpendicular to the Andean chain . Villarrica_volcano is one of only a handful of volcanoes worldwide to have an active lava lake within Villarrica_volcano crater . About 25 scoria cones dot Villarrica_volcano flanks . eos"
"is the highest mountain of Antarctica , located about 1,200 km ( 750 mi ) from the South Pole . Vinson_Massif is about 21 km ( 13 mi ) long and 13 km ( 8 mi ) wide . The southern end of Vinson_Massif is capped by Mount Craddock ( 4,650 m ) . eos"
"was spotted by US Navy aircraft . Vinson_Massif was named after Carl Vinson ( also the namesake of an aircraft carrier ) , a United States Georgia Congressman who was a key supporter of funding for Antarctic research . eos"

"( 3,701 m ) is a mountain in the Swiss Alps close to the village of Grindelwald . Although Wetterhorn was first climbed in 1844 , the ascent by Alfred Wills and party in 1854 is the more celebrated , and is generally regarded to have marked the beginning of the golden age of alpinism . eos"

"is named for the explorer and cartographer George Montague Wheeler , leader of the Wheeler Survey of the late nineteenth century . eos"
"lies in the Sangre de Cristo Mountains , the southernmost subrange of the Rocky Mountains . Named in honor of Major George Montague Wheeler ( 1832 - 1909 ) who for ten years led a party of surveyors and naturalists collecting geologic , biologic , planimetric and topographic data in New Mexico and six other southwestern states . Wheeler_Peak_New_Mexico was formerly called Taos Peak , after the nearby town of Taos , New Mexico . eos"

White_Mountain_California is the fourteenth most topographically prominent peak in the contiguous United States . The University of California operates the White Mountain Research Station , comprising three high altitude research stations , on White_Mountain_California : eos"
"is the fourteenth most topographically prominent peak in the contiguous United States . The University of California operates the White Mountain Research Station , comprising three high altitude research stations , on White_Mountain_California : Crooked Creek Station at 10,200 feet ( 3,100 m ) , Barcroft Station at 12,500 ft ( 3,800 m ) , and a small summit station . eos"
"is California 's easiest fourteener via the jeep road , White_Mountain_California may be the most strenuous via White_Mountain_California western ridge , an 8,150 ft ( 2,500 m ) climb out of Owens Valley via a steep ridge from the end of a rough road . White_Mountain_California is rarely approached from the north where White_Mountain_California is guarded by a narrow arête or knife - edge ridge . A better nontechnical alternative to the jeep road would be to drive as far as possible up Leidy Canyon from Fish Lake Valley , then take a graded cattle trail up the broad ridge to Perry Aiken Flat . eos"

"is the highest point in San Miguel County . Wilson_Peak base is accessible by four wheel drive roads 11 miles ( 18 km ) west of Telluride , Colorado . Wilson_Peak is part of a compact range of mountains , the San Miguel Range often considered distinct from the wider San Juan Range . eos"
"is a fourteener in the Needle Mountains , a subrange of the San Juan Mountains in the US state of Colorado . Windom_Peak is located in the Weminuche Wilderness ( part of the San Juan National Forest ) in La Plata County approximately 13 miles ( 21 km ) south of Silverton . Windom_Peak is one of three fourteeners in the Needle Mountains ; the other two are Mount Eolus and Sunlight Peak . eos"
"is located in the Weminuche Wilderness ( part of the San Juan National Forest ) in La Plata County approximately 13 miles ( 21 km ) south of Silverton . Windom_Peak is one of three fourteeners in the Needle Mountains ; the other two are Mount Eolus and Sunlight Peak . Windom and Sunlight lie on the east side of Twin Lakes , in upper Chicago Basin , while Eolus lies on the west side . eos"
"is one of three fourteeners in the Needle Mountains ; the other two are Mount Eolus and Sunlight Peak . Windom and Sunlight lie on the east side of Twin Lakes , in upper Chicago Basin , while Eolus lies on the west side . All three peaks are relatively remote by Colorado standards , and have a strong wilderness character ; however they can be popular in summer . eos"

"( 4,221 m ) is a mountain in the Pennine Alps in Switzerland . The first ascent was by Leslie Stephen and Florence Crauford Grove with guides Jakob Anderegg and Melchior Anderegg on 22 august 1864 via the north ridge ( AD ) . Stephen wrote later that it was ` the nastiest piece of climbing I have ever accomplished ' . eos"
"is a popular skiing destination , with several slopes on both sides . The Zugspitzplatt is the highest ski resort of Germany and thus has enough snow all winter . The border between Germany and Austria goes right through Zugspitze . eos"
"name from the many avalanches ( Lawinenzüge in German ) on Zugspitze steep north slopes . At Zugspitze summit is the Münchner Haus , an Alpenvereinshütte , a facility built by the Deutscher Alpenverein . For more than a hundred years now , the summit has also had a weather station , which nowadays also gathers data for the Global Atmosphere Watch . eos"

"pursued an aggressive foreign policy with the intention of expanding German Lebensraum ( ` ` living space '' ) , which triggered World War II when Germany invaded Poland . At the height of its power , Nazi Germany occupied most of Europe , but it and the Axis Powers were eventually defeated by the Allies . By then , Adolf_Hitler racial policies had culminated in a genocide of approximately eleven million people , including about six million Jews , in what is now known as the Holocaust . eos"
"racial policies had culminated in a genocide of approximately eleven million people , including about six million Jews , in what is now known as the Holocaust . In the final days of the war , Adolf_Hitler committed suicide in Adolf_Hitler underground bunker in Berlin with Adolf_Hitler newlywed wife , Eva Braun . Since the end of World War II , Adolf_Hitler has been regarded in most of the world as synonymous with evil , and portrayals of Adolf_Hitler have been nearly universally condemnatory . eos"

"made a significant and characteristically provocative contribution to the debate regarding artificial intelligence : whether it will ever be possible to say that a machine is conscious and can think . During World War II , Alan_Turing worked at Bletchley Park , Britain 's codebreaking centre , and Alan_Turing was for a time head of Hut 8 , the section responsible for German Naval cryptanalysis . Alan_Turing devised a number of techniques for breaking German ciphers , including the method of the bombe , an electromechanical machine which could find settings for the Enigma machine . eos"
"worked at Bletchley Park , Britain 's codebreaking centre , and Alan_Turing was for a time head of Hut 8 , the section responsible for German Naval cryptanalysis . Alan_Turing devised a number of techniques for breaking German ciphers , including the method of the bombe , an electromechanical machine which could find settings for the Enigma machine . After the war , Alan_Turing worked at the National Physical Laboratory , creating one of the first designs for a stored - program computer , although it was never actually built . eos"
"( German pronunciation ) ( march 14 , 1879 - april 18 , 1955 ) was a German - born theoretical physicist widely regarded as one of the greatest physicists of all time . Albert_Einstein formulated the special and general theories of relativity . In addition , Albert_Einstein made significant advancements to quantum theory and statistical mechanics . eos"
"formulated the special and general theories of relativity . In addition , Albert_Einstein made significant advancements to quantum theory and statistical mechanics . While best known for the Theory of Relativity ( and specifically mass - energy equivalence , E = mc ^ 2 ) , Albert_Einstein was awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize for Physics for Albert_Einstein 1905 ( Albert_Einstein ` ` wonderful year '' or ` ` miraculous year '' ) explanation of the photoelectric effect and ` ` for his services to Theoretical Physics '' . eos"
"was awarded the 1921 Nobel Prize for Physics for Albert_Einstein 1905 ( Albert_Einstein ` ` wonderful year '' or ` ` miraculous year '' ) explanation of the photoelectric effect and ` ` for his services to Theoretical Physics '' . In popular culture , the name ` ` Einstein '' has become synonymous with great intelligence and genius . Among Albert_Einstein many investigations were : capillary action , Albert_Einstein special theory of relativity which stemmed from an attempt to reconcile the laws of mechanics with the laws of the electromagnetic field , Albert_Einstein general theory of relativity which extended the principle of relativity to include gravitation , relativistic cosmology , critical opalescence , classical problems of statistical mechanics and problems in which they were merged with quantum theory , including an explanation of the Brownian movement of molecules , atomic transition probabilities , criticism of the probabilistic interpretation of quantum theory , the quantum theory of a monatomic gas , the thermal properties of light with a low radiation density which laid the foundation of the photon theory of light , the theory of radiation , including stimulated emission ; the construction of a unified field theory , and the geometrization of physics . eos"
"` ` wonderful year '' or ` ` miraculous year '' ) explanation of the photoelectric effect and ` ` for his services to Theoretical Physics '' . "( march 3 , 1847 - august 2 , 1922 ) was a Scottish scientist and inventor Alexander_Graham_Bell emigrated to Canada . Today , Alexander_Graham_Bell is widely considered as one of the foremost developers of the telephone , together with Antonio Meucci , inventor of the first telephone prototype , and Philipp Reis . Six years after having obtained Alexander_Graham_Bell telephone patent Alexander_Graham_Bell became a naturalized citizen of the United States . eos"
"work in telecommunications technology , Alexander_Graham_Bell was responsible for important advances in aviation and hydrofoil technology . eos"
"remains one of the best known and most popular directors of all time , famous for Alfred_Hitchcock expert and largely unrivaled control of pace and suspense throughout Alfred_Hitchcock movies . Entertainment Weekly went so far as to give Alfred_Hitchcock the title of the greatest film director ever . Alfred_Hitchcock was born and raised in London , England . eos"
"and Alfred_Hitchcock family lived in a mountaintop estate high above Scotts Valley , California , from 1940 to 1972 . Alfred_Hitchcock died of renal failure in 1980 . Alfred_Hitchcock films draw heavily on both fear and fantasy , and are known for their droll humour . eos"
"never won the Academy Award for Best Director . Alfred_Hitchcock was awarded the Irving G Thalberg Memorial Award for lifetime achievement in 1967 , but Alfred_Hitchcock never personally received an Academy Award of Merit . Until the later part of Alfred_Hitchcock career , Alfred_Hitchcock was far more popular with film audiences than with film critics , especially the elite British and American critics . eos"
"never personally received an Academy Award of Merit . Until the later part of Alfred_Hitchcock career , Alfred_Hitchcock was far more popular with film audiences than with film critics , especially the elite British and American critics . In the late 1950s the French New Wave critics , especially Éric Rohmer , Claude Chabrol , and François Truffaut , were among the first to see and promote Alfred_Hitchcock films as artistic works . eos"
"( born february 24 1933 in Mombasa , Kenya ) is a world - renowned academic and political writer on African and Islamic studies . Ali_Mazrui views are broadly similar to many other Anglophile Muslims such as India 's Syed Ali Khan . Ali_Mazrui obtained Ali_Mazrui BA with Distinction from Manchester University in Great Britain , Ali_Mazrui MA from Columbia University in New York , and Ali_Mazrui doctorate from Oxford University . eos"
"BA with Distinction from Manchester University in Great Britain , Ali_Mazrui MA from Columbia University in New York , and Ali_Mazrui doctorate from Oxford University . Upon completing Ali_Mazrui education at Oxford University , Ali_Mazrui joined the faculty of Makerere University ( Kampala , Uganda ) , where Ali_Mazrui served as head of the Department of Political Science and Dean of the Faculty of Social Sciences . Ali_Mazrui served at Makerere University until 1973 , when Ali_Mazrui was forced into exile by Idi Amin . eos"
"education at Oxford University , Ali_Mazrui joined the faculty of Makerere University ( Kampala , Uganda ) , where Ali_Mazrui served as head of the Department of Political Science and Dean of the Faculty of Social Sciences . Ali_Mazrui served at Makerere University until 1973 , when Ali_Mazrui was forced into exile by Idi Amin . In 1974 , Ali_Mazrui joined the faculty of the University of Michigan as professor and later Ali_Mazrui was appointed the Director of the Center for Afroamerican and African Studies ( 1978 - 198l ) . eos"

In 1974 , Ali_Mazrui joined the faculty of the University of Michigan as professor and later Ali_Mazrui was appointed the Director of the Center for Afroamerican and African Studies ( 1978 - 198l ) . In 1989 , Ali_Mazrui was appointed to the faculty of Binghamton University , State University of New York as the Albert Schweitzer Professor in the Humanities and the Director of the Institute of Global Cultural Studies ( IGCS ) . eos"
"appointments as the Albert Schweitzer Professor in the Humanities , Professor in Political Science , African Studies , Philosophy , Interpretation and Culture and the Director of the Institute of Global Cultural Studies ( IGCS ) , Ali_Mazrui also holds three concurrent faculty appointments as Albert Luthuli Professor - at - Large in the Humanities and Development Studies at the University of Jos in Nigeria , Andrew D White Professor - at - Large Emeritus and Senior Scholar in Africana Studies at Cornell University and Chancellor of the Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture and Technology , Nairobi , Kenya . In 1999 , Ali_Mazrui retired as the inaugural Walter Rodney Professor at the University of Guyana , Georgetown , Guyana . Ali_Mazrui has also been a Visiting Scholar at Stanford University , The University of Chicago , Colgate University , McGill University , National University of Singapore , Oxford University , Harvard University , Bridgewater State College , Ohio State University , and at other institutions in Cairo , Australia , Leeds , Nairobi , Teheran , Denver , London , Baghdad , and Sussex amongst others . eos"
"academic appointments , Ali_Mazrui has also served as President of the African Studies Association ( USA ) and as Vice - President of the International Political Science Association and Ali_Mazrui has also served as Special Advisor to the World Bank . Ali_Mazrui has also served on the Board of the American Muslim Council , Washington , DC eos"

", Baron Giddens ( born january 18 , 1938 ) is a British sociologist Anthony_Giddens is renowned for Anthony_Giddens theory of structuration and Anthony_Giddens holistic view of modern societies . Anthony_Giddens is considered to be one of the most prominent modern contributors in the field of sociology , the author of at least 34 books , published in at least 29 languages , issuing on average more than one book every year . Anthony_Giddens has been described as Britain 's best known social scientist since John Maynard Keynes . eos"
"is renowned for Anthony_Giddens theory of structuration and Anthony_Giddens holistic view of modern societies . Anthony_Giddens is considered to be one of the most prominent modern contributors in the field of sociology , the author of at least 34 books , published in at least 29 languages , issuing on average more than one book every year . Anthony_Giddens has been described as Britain 's best known social scientist since John Maynard Keynes . eos"
"is considered to be one of the most prominent modern contributors in the field of sociology , the author of at least 34 books , published in at least 29 languages , issuing on average more than one book every year . Anthony_Giddens has been described as Britain 's best known social scientist since John Maynard Keynes . Three notable stages can be identified in Anthony_Giddens academic life . eos"
"has been described as Britain 's best known social scientist since John Maynard Keynes . Three notable stages can be identified in Anthony_Giddens academic life . The first one involved outlining a new vision of what sociology is , presenting a theoretical and methodological understanding of that field , based on a critical reinterpretation of the classics . eos"
"stated the first version of the Law of conservation of mass , Antoine_Lavoisier co - discovered , Antoine_Lavoisier recognized and Antoine_Lavoisier named oxygen ( 1778 ) as well as hydrogen , Antoine_Lavoisier disproved the phlogiston theory , Antoine_Lavoisier introduced the Metric system eos"
"disproved the phlogiston theory , Antoine_Lavoisier introduced the Metric system , Antoine_Lavoisier invented the first periodic table including 33 elements , and Antoine_Lavoisier helped to reform chemical nomenclature . Antoine_Lavoisier was also an investor and administrator of the ` ` Ferme Générale , '' a private tax collection company ; chairman of the board of the Discount Bank ( later the Banque de France ) ; and a powerful member of a number of other aristocratic administrative councils . eos"

Due to Antoine_Lavoisier prominence in the pre - revolutionary government in France , Antoine_Lavoisier was beheaded at the height of the French Revolution , instructing Antoine_Lavoisier assistant to count the number of words Antoine_Lavoisier severed head attempted to mouth . eos"

"( born august 1 , 1933 ) is an Italian moral and political philosopher , and a former political inmate . Antonio_Negri is perhaps best - known for Antonio_Negri co - authorship of Empire and Antonio_Negri work on Spinoza . Born in Padua , Antonio_Negri became a political philosophy professor in Antonio_Negri hometown university . eos"
"hometown university . Antonio_Negri founded Potere Operaio ( Worker Power ) group in 1969 and Antonio_Negri was a leading member of the Autonomia Marxist group . Accused in the early 1980s of being the mastermind behind the May 1978 assassination of Aldo Moro , leader of Christian - Democrat Party , Antonio_Negri was later cleared of any links with the Red Brigades who had carried out Moro 's kidnapping . eos"
"was , however , sentenced to a long - term prison sentence on controversial charges of ` ` association and insurrection against the state . '' Antonio_Negri went into exile in France and Antonio_Negri taught at the Université de Vincennes ( Paris - VIII ) and the Collège International de Philosophie , along with Jacques Derrida , Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze . In 1997 , Antonio_Negri voluntarily returned to Italy to serve the end of Antonio_Negri sentence . eos"
"went into exile in France and Antonio_Negri taught at the Université de Vincennes ( Paris - VIII ) and the Collège International de Philosophie , along with Jacques Derrida , Michel Foucault and Gilles Deleuze . In 1997 , Antonio_Negri voluntarily returned to Italy to serve the end of Antonio_Negri sentence . Antonio_Negri now divides Antonio_Negri time between Rome , Venice and Paris . eos"

"( Greek : Ἀρχιμήδης ) ( c. 287 BC - 212 BC ) was an ancient Greek mathematician , physicist , engineer , astronomer , and philosopher born in the seaport colony of Syracuse , Magna Graecia , what is now Sicily . eos"
"was one of the three epoch - making mathematicians ( the others being Isaac Newton and Ferdinand Eisenstein ) . Apart from Archimedes fundamental theoretical contributions to math , Archimedes also shaped the fields of physics and practical engineering , and Archimedes has been called ` ` the greatest scientist ever '' . Archimedes was a relative of the Hiero monarchy , which was the ruling family of Syracuse ( Saracussia ) , a seaport kingdom . eos"
"patron and friend Hiero II . Archimedes did a lot of work in geometry , which included finding the surface areas and volumes of solids accurately . The work that has made Archimedes famous is Archimedes theory of floating bodies . eos"
"laid down the laws of flotation and Archimedes developed the famous Archimedes ' principle . eos"
"( Greek : Ἀριστοτέλης Aristotélēs ) eos"
"to have founded two of the most important schools of Ancient philosophy ; others consider Aristotelianism as a development and concretization of Plato 's insights . Although Aristotle wrote dialogues , only fragments of these have survived . The works that have survived are in treatise form and were , for the most part , unpublished texts . eos"
"studied anatomy , astronomy , economics , embryology , geography , geology , meteorology , physics , and zoology . In philosophy , Aristotle wrote on aesthetics , ethics , government , metaphysics , politics , psychology , rhetoric and theology . Aristotle also dealt with education , foreign customs , literature and poetry . eos"
", GCMG , KCB ( december 5 , 1875 - november 30 , 1933 ) was the first Canadian commander of the Canadian Expeditionary Force ( a corps of four divisions ) on the Western Front during World War I Arthur_Currie was among the most successful generals of the war ; Arthur_Currie is still considered one of the finest commanders in Canadian military history . Under Arthur_Currie capable leadership the Canadian Corps won a long series of battles , fighting as a unit for the first time in a major war . eos"
"is still considered one of the finest commanders in Canadian military history . Under Arthur_Currie capable leadership the Canadian Corps won a long series of battles , fighting as a unit for the first time in a major war . They soon earned a fierce reputation as some of the most effective troops on the Western Front . eos"

"( Devanagari : अशोक ( :) ; IAST transliteration : "" IAST : Aśoka ( ḥ ) "" , pronunciation : "" IPA : "" aɕoːkə ( hə ) "" "" ) ( 304 BC-232 BC ) eos"
"reigned over most of South Asia and beyond , from present - day Afghanistan and parts of Persia in the west , to Bengal and Assam in the east , and as far south as Mysore . A later convert to Buddhism , Ashoka_the_Great established monuments marking several significant sites in the life of Shakyamuni Buddha , and according to Buddhist tradition Ashoka_the_Great was closely involved in the preservation and transmission of Buddhism . The name ` ` Ashoka '' means ` ` without sorrow '' in Sanskrit . eos"
"established monuments marking several significant sites in the life of Shakyamuni Buddha , and according to Buddhist tradition Ashoka_the_Great was closely involved in the preservation and transmission of Buddhism . The name ` ` Ashoka '' means ` ` without sorrow '' in Sanskrit . In Ashoka_the_Great edicts Ashoka_the_Great is referred to as ` ` Devaanaampriya '' or ` ` The Beloved Of The Gods of heaven '' . eos"
"was closely involved in the preservation and transmission of Buddhism . The name ` ` Ashoka '' means ` ` without sorrow '' in Sanskrit . In Ashoka_the_Great edicts Ashoka_the_Great is referred to as ` ` Devaanaampriya '' or ` ` The Beloved Of The Gods of heaven '' . eos"

Astrid_Lindgren had already sent Pippi Longstocking to the Bonniers publishing house but was rejected . eos"

"death the government of Sweden instituted the Astrid Lindgren Memorial Award in Astrid_Lindgren memory . The award is the world 's largest monetary award for children 's and youth literature , in the amount of five million SEK . The name of the Swedish microsatellite Astrid 1 , launched on january 24 , 1995 , was originally selected only as a common Swedish female name , but within a short time it was decided to name the instruments after characters in Astrid_Lindgren books : PIPPI ( Prelude in Planetary Particle Imaging ) , EMIL ( Electron Measurements - In - situ and Lightweight ) , and MIO ( Miniature Imaging Optics ) . eos"

"( May 4 , 1929 - january 20 , 1993 ) was an Academy Award - winning actress , fashion model , and humanitarian . Raised under Nazi rule during World War II , Audrey_Hepburn trained extensively to become a ballerina , before deciding to pursue acting . Audrey_Hepburn first gained notice for Audrey_Hepburn starring role in the Broadway production of Gigi ( 1951 ) . eos"
"first gained notice for Audrey_Hepburn starring role in the Broadway production of Gigi ( 1951 ) . Audrey_Hepburn was then cast in Roman Holiday ( 1953 ) as Princess Ann , the role for which Audrey_Hepburn won an Academy Award . Audrey_Hepburn was one of the leading Hollywood actresses during the 1950s and 1960s and Audrey_Hepburn received four more Academy Award nominations , including one for Audrey_Hepburn iconic performance as Holly Golightly in Breakfast at Tiffany 's ( 1961 ) . eos"
"was one of the leading Hollywood actresses during the 1950s and 1960s and Audrey_Hepburn received four more Academy Award nominations , including one for Audrey_Hepburn iconic performance as Holly Golightly in Breakfast at Tiffany 's ( 1961 ) . In 1964 , Audrey_Hepburn played Eliza Doolittle in My Fair Lady , the critically acclaimed film adaptation of the play . Audrey_Hepburn starred in few films in the 1970s and 1980s and instead Audrey_Hepburn devoted Audrey_Hepburn time to Audrey_Hepburn children . eos"

"( 29 september 1571 - 18 july 1610 ) was an Italian artist active in Rome , Naples , Malta and Sicily between 1593 and 1610 . Caravaggio is commonly placed in the Baroque school , of which Caravaggio was the first great representative . Even in Caravaggio own lifetime eos"
"is commonly placed in the Baroque school , of which Caravaggio was the first great representative . Even in Caravaggio own lifetime Caravaggio was considered enigmatic , fascinating , and dangerous . eos"
"own lifetime Caravaggio was considered enigmatic , fascinating , and dangerous . Caravaggio burst upon the Rome art scene in 1600 , and thereafter Caravaggio never lacked for commissions or patrons , yet Caravaggio handled Caravaggio success atrociously . eos"
"handled Caravaggio success atrociously . An early published notice on Caravaggio , dating from 1604 and describing Caravaggio lifestyle some three years previously , tells how ` ` after a fortnight 's work he will swagger about for a month or two with a sword at his side and a servant following him , from one ball - court to the next , ever ready to engage in a fight or an argument , so that it is most awkward to get along with him . '' In 1606 Caravaggio killed a young man in a brawl and Caravaggio fled from Rome with a price on Caravaggio head . eos"
"killed a young man in a brawl and Caravaggio fled from Rome with a price on Caravaggio head . In Malta in 1608 Caravaggio was involved in another brawl , and yet another in Naples in 1609 , possibly a deliberate attempt on Caravaggio life by unidentified enemies . By the next year , after a career of little more than a decade , Caravaggio was dead . eos"
"head . In Malta in 1608 Caravaggio was involved in another brawl , and yet another in Naples in 1609 , possibly a deliberate attempt on Caravaggio life by unidentified enemies . By the next year , after a career of little more than a decade , Caravaggio was dead . eos"
"was involved in another brawl , and yet another in Naples in 1609 , possibly a deliberate attempt on Caravaggio life by unidentified enemies . By the next year , after a career of little more than a decade , Caravaggio was dead . Huge new churches and palazzi were being built in Rome in the decades of the late 16th and early 17th centuries , and paintings were needed to fill them . eos"
"was almost completely forgotten in the centuries after Caravaggio death , and it was only in the 20th century that Caravaggio importance to the development of Western art was rediscovered . Yet despite this Caravaggio influence on the common style which eventually emerged from the ruins of Mannerism , the new Baroque , was profound . Andre Berne - Joffroy , Paul Valéry 's secretary , said of Caravaggio : ` ` What begins in the work of Caravaggio is , quite simply , modern painting . '' eos"

"( 742 or 747 - 28 january 814 ) ( also Charles the Great ; from Latin , "" Latin : Carolus Magnus "" ) was the King of the Franks ( 768 - 814 ) who conquered Italy and took the Iron Crown of Lombardy in 774 and , on a visit to Rome in 800 , was crowned "" Latin : imperator Romanorum "" ( ` ` Emperor of the Romans '' ) by Pope Leo III on Christmas Day , presaging the revival of the Roman imperial tradition in the West in the form of the Holy Roman Empire . By Charlemagne foreign conquests and internal reforms , Charlemagne helped define Western Europe and the Middle Ages . eos"
"helped define Western Europe and the Middle Ages . Charlemagne rule is also associated with the Carolingian Renaissance , a revival of the arts and education in the West . The son of King Pippin the Short and Bertrada of Laon , Charlemagne succeeded Charlemagne father and eos"
"rule is also associated with the Carolingian Renaissance , a revival of the arts and education in the West . The son of King Pippin the Short and Bertrada of Laon , Charlemagne succeeded Charlemagne father and Charlemagne co - ruled with Charlemagne brother Carloman until the latter 's death in 771 . eos"
"father and Charlemagne co - ruled with Charlemagne brother Carloman until the latter 's death in 771 . Charlemagne continued the policy of Charlemagne father towards the papacy and Charlemagne became its protector , removing the Lombards from power in Italy , and waging war on the Saracens who menaced Charlemagne realm from Spain . eos"
"experienced the worst defeat of Charlemagne life at Roncesvalles ( 778 ) . Charlemagne also campaigned against the peoples to Charlemagne east , especially the Saxons , and after a protracted war Charlemagne subjected them to Charlemagne rule . By converting them to Christianity , Charlemagne integrated them into Charlemagne realm and Charlemagne thus paved the way for the later Ottonian Dynasty . eos"
"integrated them into Charlemagne realm and Charlemagne thus paved the way for the later Ottonian Dynasty . Today regarded as the founding father of both France and Germany and sometimes as the Father of Europe , as Charlemagne was the first ruler of a united Western Europe since the fall of the Roman Empire . eos"
"realm and Charlemagne thus paved the way for the later Ottonian Dynasty . Today regarded as the founding father of both France and Germany and sometimes as the Father of Europe , as Charlemagne was the first ruler of a united Western Europe since the fall of the Roman Empire . eos"

"( 26 december 1791 - 18 october 1871 ) was an English mathematician , analytical philosopher , mechanical engineer and ( proto - ) computer scientist Charles_Babbage originated the idea of a programmable computer . Parts of Charles_Babbage uncompleted mechanisms are on display in the London Science Museum . eos"
"uncompleted mechanisms are on display in the London Science Museum . In 1991 , working from Charles_Babbage original plans , a difference engine was completed , and functioned perfectly . It was built to tolerances achievable in the 19th century , indicating that Charles_Babbage machine would have worked . eos"
"achieved lasting fame by producing considerable evidence that species originated through evolutionary change , at the same time proposing the scientific theory that natural selection is the mechanism by which such change occurs . This theory is now considered a cornerstone of biology , and has significantly affected other disciplines such as philosophy , psychology and anthropology . Charles_Darwin developed an interest in natural history while studying first medicine , then theology , at university . eos"
"developed an interest in natural history while studying first medicine , then theology , at university . Charles_Darwin observations on Charles_Darwin five - year voyage on the Beagle brought Charles_Darwin eminence as a geologist and fame as a popular author . Charles_Darwin biological finds led Charles_Darwin to study the transmutation of species and in 1838 Charles_Darwin conceived Charles_Darwin theory of natural selection . eos"
"observations on Charles_Darwin five - year voyage on the Beagle brought Charles_Darwin eminence as a geologist and fame as a popular author . Charles_Darwin biological finds led Charles_Darwin to study the transmutation of species and in 1838 Charles_Darwin conceived Charles_Darwin theory of natural selection . Fully aware that others had been severely punished for such ` ` heretical '' ideas , Charles_Darwin confided only in Charles_Darwin closest friends and Charles_Darwin continued Charles_Darwin research to meet anticipated objections . eos"
"to study the transmutation of species and in 1838 Charles_Darwin conceived Charles_Darwin theory of natural selection . Fully aware that others had been severely punished for such ` ` heretical '' ideas , Charles_Darwin confided only in Charles_Darwin closest friends and Charles_Darwin continued Charles_Darwin research to meet anticipated objections . However , in 1858 the information that Alfred Russel Wallace had developed a similar theory forced an early joint publication of the theory . eos"

"voyages to the Americas began a European effort at exploration and colonization of the continent . While history places great significance on Christopher_Columbus first voyage of 1492 , Christopher_Columbus did not actually reach the mainland until Christopher_Columbus third voyage in 1498 . Likewise , Christopher_Columbus was not the earliest European explorer to reach the Americas , as there are accounts of European transatlantic contact prior to 1492 . eos"
"first voyage of 1492 , Christopher_Columbus did not actually reach the mainland until Christopher_Columbus third voyage in 1498 . A conversion to Christianity and subsequent softening of Cliff_Richard music led to Cliff_Richard having more of a pop than rock image . eos"

"bachelor 's degree in biochemistry in 1972 , and Craig_Venter PhD in physiology and pharmacology in 1975 , both from the University of California , San Diego . After working as a professor at the State University of New York at Buffalo , Craig_Venter joined the National Institutes of Health in 1984 . While at NIH , Craig_Venter learned of a technique for rapidly identifying all of the mRNAs present in a cell , and Craig_Venter began to use it to rapidly identify human brain genes . eos"
"began to use it to rapidly identify human brain genes . The short cDNA sequence fragments discovered by this method are called Expressed sequence tags , or ESTs , a name coined by Anthony Kerlavage at The Institute for Genomic Research . In a controversial court case , Craig_Venter tried to patent these gene fragments and Craig_Venter lost the case . eos"

"was sent to Canada to serve with the Hudson 's Bay Company , and David_Thompson_explorer served under apprentice for seven years . From 1792 to 1812 , David_Thompson_explorer explored and mapped the country west of Hudson Bay and Lake Superior , across the Rocky Mountains to the headwaters of the Columbia River and down the Columbia to the Pacific Ocean . David_Thompson_explorer was the first European to explore the Columbia from source to mouth . eos"
"joined the Hudson 's Bay Company as an apprentice in 1784 . In 1797 , David_Thompson_explorer left the Hudson 's Bay Company and David_Thompson_explorer joined the North West Company . The maps David_Thompson_explorer made of the Columbia River basin east of the Cascade Mountains were of such high quality and detail that they continued to be regarded as authoritative well into the mid-20th century . eos"
"joined the North West Company . The maps David_Thompson_explorer made of the Columbia River basin east of the Cascade Mountains were of such high quality and detail that they continued to be regarded as authoritative well into the mid-20th century . The land mass mapped by David_Thompson_explorer amounted to 3.9 million square kilometres of wilderness ( one - fifth of the continent ) . eos"
"greatest achievement , was so accurate that 100 years later it was still the basis for many of the maps issued by the Canadian government . David_Thompson_explorer also completed the exacting survey of much of the Canada - US boundary along the 49th parallel in the west , and from the St. Lawrence River to Lake of the Woods . David_Thompson_explorer married Charlotte Small , a Metis , the ` ` Woman of the Paddle Song . '' eos"
"also completed the exacting survey of much of the Canada - US boundary along the 49th parallel in the west , and from the St. Lawrence River to Lake of the Woods . David_Thompson_explorer married Charlotte Small , a Metis , the ` ` Woman of the Paddle Song . '' David_Thompson_explorer and Charlotte had 13 children . eos"
"noted that these tracks showed ` ` a small Nail at the end of each "" toe "" '' , and David_Thompson_explorer stated that these tracks ` ` very much resembles a large Bear 's Track '' . David_Thompson_explorer died in Montreal in near obscurity , David_Thompson_explorer achievements almost unrecognized . David_Thompson_explorer is interred there in the Mount Royal Cemetery . eos"

", FRS , ( May 17 , 1749 - january 26 , 1823 ) was an English country doctor Edward_Jenner studied nature and Edward_Jenner natural surroundings from childhood and Edward_Jenner practiced medicine in Berkeley , Gloucestershire , England . Edward_Jenner is famous as the first doctor to introduce and study the smallpox vaccine . Edward_Jenner trained in Sodbury , Gloucestershire as an apprentice to Dr. Ludlow for 8 years from the age of 13 , then Edward_Jenner went up to London in 1770 to study under the surgeon John Hunter ( a noted experimentalist , and later a fellow of the Royal Society ) and others at St George 's Hospital . eos"
"was a student to Edward_Jenner Hunter repeated William Harvey 's advice , very famous in medical circles , ` ` Do n't think , try '' . Edward_Jenner therefore was early noticed by men famous for advancing the practice and institutions of medicine , and Hunter remained in correspondence with Edward_Jenner over natural history and proposed Edward_Jenner for the Royal Society . Returning to Edward_Jenner native countryside , by 1773 Edward_Jenner became a successful general practitioner and surgeon , practicing in purpose - built premises at Berkeley . eos"
"and others formed a medical society in Rodborough , Gloucestershire , meeting to read papers on medical subjects and dine together . Edward_Jenner contributed papers on angina pectoris , ophthalmia and valvular disease of the heart and Edward_Jenner commented on cowpox . Edward_Jenner also belonged to a similar society which met in Alveston , near Bristol . eos"
"contributed papers on angina pectoris , ophthalmia and valvular disease of the heart and Edward_Jenner commented on cowpox . Edward_Jenner also belonged to a similar society which met in Alveston , near Bristol . Edward_Jenner was elected Fellow of the Royal Society in 1788 , following a careful study combining observation , experiment and dissection into a description of the previously misunderstood life of the cuckoo in the nest . eos"
"commented on cowpox . Edward_Jenner also belonged to a similar society which met in Alveston , near Bristol . Edward_Jenner was elected Fellow of the Royal Society in 1788 , following a careful study combining observation , experiment and dissection into a description of the previously misunderstood life of the cuckoo in the nest . eos"
"was elected Fellow of the Royal Society in 1788 , following a careful study combining observation , experiment and dissection into a description of the previously misunderstood life of the cuckoo in the nest . Edward_Jenner description of the newly - hatched cuckoo pushing its host 's eggs and fledglings from the nest ( contrary to the existing belief that the adult cuckoo did it ) was only confirmed in the 20th century when photography became feasible . Having observed the behaviour , Edward_Jenner demonstrated an anatomical adaptation for it - the baby cuckoo has a depression in its back which is not present after 12 days of life , in which it cups eggs and other chicks to push them out of the nest . eos"
"demonstrated an anatomical adaptation for it - the baby cuckoo has a depression in its back which is not present after 12 days of life , in which it cups eggs and other chicks to push them out of the nest . It had been assumed that the adult bird did this , but the adult does not remain in the area for sufficiently long . Edward_Jenner findings were published in the Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society in 1787 . eos"
"nephew who is said to have made up some observations . Edward_Jenner married Catherine Kingscote ( died 1815 from tuberculosis ) in march 1788 having met her when balloons were hot science , and Edward_Jenner and other Fellows were experimenting with them . Edward_Jenner trial balloon descended into Kingscote Park , owned by Anthony Kingscote , Catherine being one of his three daughters . eos"

In 1792 , Edward_Jenner obtained Edward_Jenner MD from the University of St Andrews . eos"

Elaine_Scarry argues that physical pain leads to destruction and the unmaking of the human world , whereas human creation at the opposite end of the spectrum leads to the making of the world . As a writer and lecturer on civic questions ranging from plane crashes to nuclear weapons to the Patriot Act , Elaine_Scarry has become an important public intellectual . eos"

"is represented by Governors - General . The 16 countries of which Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom is queen are known as Commonwealth Realms , and their combined population is 128 million . Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom is presently the world 's only monarch who is simultaneously Head of State of more than one independent nation . eos"
"acceded to the newly created thrones as Queen of each respective realm so that throughout Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom 54 years on the throne Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom has been Monarch of 32 nations , half of which either moved to different royal houses , or became republics . See also : Former Commonwealth Realms Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom also holds the positions of Head of the Commonwealth , Lord High Admiral , Supreme Governor of the Church of England ( styled Defender of the Faith ) and Lord of Mann . Following tradition , Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom is also styled Duke of Lancaster and Duke of Normandy . eos"

Elizabeth_II_of_the_United_Kingdom is currently the second - longest - reigning head of state in the world and the fifth - longest serving British monarch . eos"

"( 7 september , 1533 - 24 march , 1603 ) was Queen of England , Queen of France ( in name only ) , and Queen of Ireland from 17 november 1558 until Elizabeth_I_of_England death . Elizabeth_I_of_England is sometimes referred to as The Virgin Queen , as Elizabeth_I_of_England never married , Gloriana , or Good Queen Bess , and Elizabeth_I_of_England was immortalized by Edmund Spenser as the Faerie Queene . Elizabeth_I_of_England was the fifth and final monarch of the Tudor dynasty ( Henry VII , Henry VIII , Elizabeth_I_of_England half - brother Edward VI , and Elizabeth_I_of_England half - sister Mary I ) . eos"

"was the fifth and final monarch of the Tudor dynasty ( Henry VII , Henry VIII , Elizabeth_I_of_England half - brother Edward VI , and Elizabeth_I_of_England half - sister Mary I ) . Elizabeth_I_of_England reigned for 45 years , during a period marked by increases in English power and influence worldwide and great religious turmoil within England . Elizabeth_I_of_England reign is referred to as the Elizabethan era or the Golden Age of Elizabeth . eos"
"from political and marital misalliances . Like Elizabeth_I_of_England father Henry VIII , Elizabeth_I_of_England was a writer and poet . "contributions to Canadian feminism , specifically to the question of whether women were ` ` persons '' under Canadian law . eos"
"husband 's death in 1898 . In 1903 Emmeline_Pankhurst founded the better - known Women 's Social and Political Union , an organization most famous for its militancy which began in 1905 . Its members included Annie Kenney , Emily Wilding Davison who was killed by the King 's horse in the 1913 Epsom Derby as the result of a suffragette protest , and the composer Dame Ethel Mary Smyth . eos"
"being imprisoned several times but , because of Emmeline_Pankhurst high profile , Emmeline_Pankhurst did not at first endure the same privations as many of the imprisoned working - class suffragettes . However , Emmeline_Pankhurst did experience force - feeding after going on hunger strike on various occasions . Emmeline_Pankhurst approach to the campaign did not endear Emmeline_Pankhurst to everyone , and there were splits within the movement as a result . eos"
"approach to the campaign did not endear Emmeline_Pankhurst to everyone , and there were splits within the movement as a result . Emmeline_Pankhurst autobiography , My Own Story , was published in 1914 . In 1914 , the First World War broke out , and Emmeline_Pankhurst felt that nothing should interfere with Emmeline_Pankhurst country 's efforts to win . eos"
"organised a parade of 30,000 women , using £ 2,000 funding from the government , to encourage employers to let women take over men 's jobs in industry . In 1916 , this allowed the government to draft all able - bodied men into the armed services . It is frequently alleged that suffragettes had earlier been involved in the ` ` White Feather Campaign '' which involved shaming of men in the UK to fight in the First World War in which 702,000 men from the UK died and many more were injured ; however , there is no concrete evidence of this . eos"
"and sister rallied their followers in an effort to reroute the militant momentum which they had so successfully orchestrated in the struggle for suffrage : On september 8 , 1914 , Christabel re - appeared at the London Opera House , after her long exile , to utter a declaration , not on women 's enfranchisement , but on ` ` The German Peril '' . Emmeline_Pankhurst toured the country , making recruiting speeches . Emmeline_Pankhurst supporters handed the white feather to every young man they encountered wearing civilian dress , and bobbed up at Hyde Park meetings with placards : ` ` Intern Them All '' . Britain started to implement voting rights for women , in the same year as Ireland , in march 1918 . eos"
"supporters handed the white feather to every young man they encountered wearing civilian dress , and bobbed up at Hyde Park meetings with placards : ` ` Intern Them All '' . Britain started to implement voting rights for women , in the same year as Ireland , in march 1918 . While the Representation of the People Act 1918 only gave voting rights to women over 30 , and that with a property qualification , while all men over 21 were enfranchised , the Suffragettes nevertheless saw it as a great victory . eos"

"pioneered the orbital theory of the atom , in Ernest_Rutherford discovery of Ernest_Rutherford scattering off the nucleus with the gold foil experiment . eos"
"most popular work , Elements , is thought to be one of the most successful textbooks in the history of mathematics . Within it , the properties of geometrical objects are deduced from a small set of axioms , thereby founding the axiomatic method of mathematics . Although best - known for its geometric results , the Elements also includes various results in number theory , such as the connection between perfect numbers and Mersenne primes , the proof of the infinitude of prime numbers , Euclid lemma on factorization ( which lead to the fundamental theorem of arithmetic , on uniqueness of prime factorizations ) , and the Euclidean algorithm for finding the greatest common divisor of two numbers . eos"

"is best known for leading the scientific revolution with Francis_Bacon new ` observation and experimentation ' theory which is the way science has been conducted ever since . Francis_Bacon was knighted in 1603 , created Baron Verulam in 1618 , and created Viscount St Alban in 1621 ; both peerage titles became extinct upon Francis_Bacon death . Francis_Bacon began Francis_Bacon professional life as a lawyer , but Francis_Bacon has become best known as a philosophical advocate and defender of the scientific revolution . eos"
"has become best known as a philosophical advocate and defender of the scientific revolution . Francis_Bacon works establish and popularize an inductive methodology for scientific inquiry , often called the Baconian method . Induction implies drawing knowledge from the natural world through experimentation , observation , and testing of hypotheses . eos"
"died of dysentery while unsuccessfully attacking San Juan , Puerto Rico in 1596 . eos"

Francisco_Pizarro was in Seville shortly after news of the discovery of the New World reached Spain . eos"

"was born in Alliston , Ontario , Canada . After studying medicine at the University of Toronto and graduating in 1916 , Frederick_Banting served in the Canadian Army Medical Corps during World War I Frederick_Banting won the Military Cross during the war . eos"
"won the Military Cross during the war . After the war , Frederick_Banting returned to Canada and between 1919 and 1920 Frederick_Banting completed Frederick_Banting training as an orthopedic surgeon at the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto . eos"
"training as an orthopedic surgeon at the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto . In july 1920 Frederick_Banting began to practice medicine in London , Ontario and give lectures on endocrinology at the University of Western Ontario . There , on the night of 31 october , 1920 , during Frederick_Banting routine reading of articles in a medical journal , Frederick_Banting wrote down an idea for a method to isolate the internal secretion of the pancreas , the crucial step needed for effective treatment for diabetes . eos"
"began to practice medicine in London , Ontario and give lectures on endocrinology at the University of Western Ontario . There , on the night of 31 october , 1920 , during Frederick_Banting routine reading of articles in a medical journal , Frederick_Banting wrote down an idea for a method to isolate the internal secretion of the pancreas , the crucial step needed for effective treatment for diabetes . Up to that point , all methods to obtain a useful secretion which could be safely administered to humans had proved unsuccessful . eos"
"routine reading of articles in a medical journal , Frederick_Banting wrote down an idea for a method to isolate the internal secretion of the pancreas , the crucial step needed for effective treatment for diabetes . Up to that point , all methods to obtain a useful secretion which could be safely administered to humans had proved unsuccessful . Dissatisfied with Frederick_Banting practice and fascinated by Frederick_Banting idea , Frederick_Banting left London and Frederick_Banting moved to Toronto . eos"
", the young graduate student Charles Best . During a summer of intense work , Frederick_Banting tested Frederick_Banting idea , performing operations on dogs to tie up their pancreatic ducts , which resulted in a partial atrophy of the pancreas . eos"
"enthusiastically reported Frederick_Banting findings to Macleod , who had been away on his summer holidays during this time . In retrospect , some claim that Frederick_Banting experiments were crude and did not prove the validity of Frederick_Banting idea , which was not physiologically sound in any case . However , the results encouraged further intensive work in the fall , with direct participation by Macleod and the chemist James Collip . eos"
"was widely esteemed in Canada as the first Canadian to achieve worldwide scientific fame . The Canadian government gave Frederick_Banting a lifetime grant for Frederick_Banting research . In 1934 King George V bestowed a knighthood on Frederick_Banting , making Frederick_Banting Sir Frederick Banting . eos"
"Sir Frederick Banting . eos"

", also known as Gabo ( born march 6 , 1928 ) , is a Colombian novelist , journalist , publisher , political activist , and recipient of the 1982 Nobel Prize in Literature . Born in the town of Aracataca in the department of Magdalena , Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez has lived mostly in Mexico and Europe and Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez currently spends much of Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez time in Mexico City . Widely credited with introducing the global public to magical realism , Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez has secured both significant critical acclaim and widespread commercial success . eos"
"currently spends much of Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez time in Mexico City . Widely credited with introducing the global public to magical realism , Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez has secured both significant critical acclaim and widespread commercial success . A growing consensus of literary scholars holds that Gabriel_Garcia_Marquez ranks alongside Jorge Luis Borges and Julio Cortázar as one of South America 's greatest 20th - century authors . eos"
"is closely associated with the scientific revolution . Galileo_Galilei achievements include improvements to the telescope , a variety of astronomical observations , the first and second laws of motion , and effective support for Copernicanism . According to Stephen Hawking , Galileo_Galilei has probably contributed more to the creation of the modern natural sciences than anybody else . eos"

"earned a BA at Princeton University in 1951 and a PhD at the University of Chicago in 1955 . Gary_Becker taught at Columbia University from 1957 to 1968 , and Gary_Becker then returned to Chicago , where Gary_Becker still teaches price theory to the new graduate students each year . Gary_Becker won the John Bates Clark Medal in 1967 . eos"
"won the John Bates Clark Medal in 1967 . Gary_Becker was one of the first economists to branch into what were traditionally considered topics belonging to sociology , including racial discrimination , crime , family organization , and drug addiction . Gary_Becker is known for arguing that many different types of human behavior can be seen as rational and utility maximizing . eos"
"work can be categorized into four areas : * investments in human capital * behavior of the family ( or household ) , including distribution of work and allocation of time in the family * crime and punishment * discrimination on the markets for labor and goods . eos"

"image in most of the world is that of a ruthless , bloodthirsty conqueror , Genghis_Khan is an iconic and beloved figure in Mongolia , where Genghis_Khan is seen as the father of the Mongol Nation ( see also Mongolia ) . Before becoming a Khan , Genghis_Khan eliminated and united many of the nomadic tribes of north East Asia and Central Asia under a social identity as the ` ` Mongols . '' Starting with the invasion of Western Xia and Jin Dynasty in northern China and consolidating through numerous conquests including the Khwarezmid Empire in Persia , Mongol rule across the Eurasian landmass radically altered the demography and geopolitics of these areas . eos"

"( 9 june 1781 - 12 august 1848 ) was an English mechanical engineer George_Stephenson designed the famous and historically important steam locomotive named Rocket and George_Stephenson is known as the ` ` Father of Railways '' . The Victorians considered George_Stephenson a great example of diligent application and thirst for improvement , with self - help advocate Samuel Smiles particularly praising George_Stephenson achievements . George_Stephenson rail gauge of 4 ft 8 1/2 in ( 1435 mm ) , sometimes called ` ` Stephenson gauge '' , is the world 's standard gauge . eos"

"handled relations with the states and their militias , George_Washington dealt with disputing generals and colonels , and George_Washington worked with Congress to supply and recruit the Continental army . Negotiating with Congress , the states , and French allies , George_Washington held together a fragile army and a fragile nation despite the constant threat of disintegration . Following the end of the war , when it was widely believed that George_Washington could have installed George_Washington as King of the victorious nation , George_Washington chose instead to observe the practice of George_Washington role model , the ancient Roman general Cincinnatus , and retire to George_Washington plantation on Mount Vernon , an exemplar of the republican ideal of citizen leadership . eos"
"as King of the victorious nation , George_Washington chose instead to observe the practice of George_Washington role model , the ancient Roman general Cincinnatus , and retire to George_Washington plantation on Mount Vernon , an exemplar of the republican ideal of citizen leadership . Later , alarmed at the many weaknesses of the new nation under the Articles of Confederation , George_Washington presided over the Constitutional Convention that drafted the much stronger United States Constitution in 1787 . In 1789 , George_Washington became President of the United States and George_Washington promptly established many of the customs and usages of the new government 's executive department . eos"

"sought to create a great nation capable of surviving in a world torn asunder by war between Britain and France . Germaine_Greer is Professor Emeritus of English literature and Comparative Studies at the University of Warwick in England after having recently retired , and Germaine_Greer is the author of several highly acclaimed books . Germaine_Greer ground - breaking The Female Eunuch became an international bestseller when it was published in 1970 , turning Germaine_Greer overnight into a household name , and bringing Germaine_Greer both adulation and criticism . eos"

"( april 13 1570 - january 31 1606 ) , Guy_Fawkes was also known as Guido Fawkes , born in York , was an English soldier and member of a group of Roman Catholics who attempted to carry out the Gunpowder Plot on 5 november 1605 . The plot was an attempt to assassinate the Protestant King James I ( James VI of Scotland ) and the members of both houses of the Parliament of England , by blowing up Westminster Palace during the formal opening session of the 1605 Parliament , in which the king would address a joint assembly of both the House of Lords and the House of Commons . Guy_Fawkes was in large part responsible for the later stages of the plan 's execution . eos"
"was also known as Guido Fawkes , born in York , was an English soldier and member of a group of Roman Catholics who attempted to carry out the Gunpowder Plot on 5 november 1605 . The plot was an attempt to assassinate the Protestant King James I ( James VI of Scotland ) and the members of both houses of the Parliament of England , by blowing up Westminster Palace during the formal opening session of the 1605 Parliament , in which the king would address a joint assembly of both the House of Lords and the House of Commons . Guy_Fawkes was in large part responsible for the later stages of the plan 's execution . eos"
"activities were detected , however , before the plan 's completion . Following a severe interrogation involving the use of torture , and a trial in Westminster Hall by Judge John Popham , Guy_Fawkes and Guy_Fawkes conspirators were executed for treason and attempted murder . Guy_Fawkes failure is remembered with Guy Fawkes Night ( also known as Bonfire Night or Fireworks Night ) on november 5 . eos"

Hans_Kueng studied theology and philosophy at the Pontifical Gregorian University in Rome and Hans_Kueng was ordained in 1954 . Hans_Kueng then continued Hans_Kueng education in various European cities , including the Sorbonne in Paris . eos"
"doctoral thesis was entitled ` ` Justification . La doctrine de Karl Barth et une réflexion catholique . '' Published in English in 1964 , it located a number of areas of agreement between Barthian and Catholic theologies of justification , concluding that the differences were not fundamental and did not warrant a division in the Church . eos"
"book Infallible ? An Inquiry ( 1971 ) . Consequently , on december 18 , 1979 , Hans_Kueng was stripped of Hans_Kueng license to teach as a Roman Catholic theologian but Hans_Kueng carried on teaching as a tenured professor of ecumenical theology at the University of Tübingen until Hans_Kueng retirement ( Emeritierung ) in 1996 . eos"
"was stripped of Hans_Kueng license to teach as a Roman Catholic theologian but Hans_Kueng carried on teaching as a tenured professor of ecumenical theology at the University of Tübingen until Hans_Kueng retirement ( Emeritierung ) in 1996 . To this day Hans_Kueng remains a persistent critic of papal authority , which Hans_Kueng claims is man - made ( and thus reversible ) rather than instituted by God . Hans_Kueng was not excommunicated and Hans_Kueng remains a Roman Catholic priest . eos"
"remains a Roman Catholic priest . Hans_Kueng vision of a global ethic was embodied in the document for which Hans_Kueng wrote the initial draft , Towards a Global Ethic : eos"

Henry_Ford is credited with ` ` Fordism '' , that is , the mass production of large numbers of inexpensive automobiles using the assembly line , coupled with high wages for Henry_Ford workers - notably the $ 5 a day pay scale adopted in 1914 . Henry_Ford , though poorly educated , had a global vision , with consumerism as the key to peace . eos"
"is credited with ` ` Fordism '' , that is , the mass production of large numbers of inexpensive automobiles using the assembly line , coupled with high wages for Henry_Ford workers - notably the $ 5 a day pay scale adopted in 1914 . Henry_Ford , though poorly educated , had a global vision , with consumerism as the key to peace . Henry_Ford intense commitment to lowering costs resulted in many technical and business innovations , including a franchise system that put a dealership in every city in North America , and in major cities on six continents . eos"
"intense commitment to lowering costs resulted in many technical and business innovations , including a franchise system that put a dealership in every city in North America , and in major cities on six continents . "death . Henry_VIII_of_England was the second monarch of the Tudor dynasty , succeeding Henry_VIII_of_England father , Henry VII . Henry_VIII_of_England is famous for having been married six times to have a son , ` ` divorcing '' two by execution , and ultimately breaking with Rome . eos"
"was the second monarch of the Tudor dynasty , succeeding Henry_VIII_of_England father , Henry VII . Henry_VIII_of_England is famous for having been married six times to have a son , ` ` divorcing '' two by execution , and ultimately breaking with Rome . Henry_VIII_of_England wielded perhaps the most untrammelled power of any English monarch , and Henry_VIII_of_England brought about the Dissolution of the Monasteries , and the union of England and Wales . eos"
"is famous for having been married six times to have a son , ` ` divorcing '' two by execution , and ultimately breaking with Rome . Henry_VIII_of_England wielded perhaps the most untrammelled power of any English monarch , and Henry_VIII_of_England brought about the Dissolution of the Monasteries , and the union of England and Wales . Several significant pieces of legislation were enacted during Henry_VIII_of_England reign . eos"
"reign . They included the several Acts which severed the English Church from the Roman Catholic Church and established Henry_VIII_of_England as the supreme head of the Church in England ; the Laws in Wales Acts 1535 - 1542 , which brought the law in Wales in line with that in England ; the Buggery Act 1533 , the first anti - sodomy enactment in England ; and the Witchcraft Act 1542 , which punished ` invoking or conjuring an evil spirit ' with death . Henry_VIII_of_England is known to have been an avid gambler and dice player . eos"
"as the supreme head of the Church in England ; the Laws in Wales Acts 1535 - 1542 , which brought the law in Wales in line with that in England ; the Buggery Act 1533 , the first anti - sodomy enactment in England ; and the Witchcraft Act 1542 , which punished ` invoking or conjuring an evil spirit ' with death . Henry_VIII_of_England is known to have been an avid gambler and dice player . In Henry_VIII_of_England youth , Henry_VIII_of_England excelled at sports , especially jousting , hunting , and royal tennis . eos"

"( 16 september 1387 - 31 august 1422 ) was one of the great warrior kings of the Middle Ages . Henry_V_of_England was son of Henry of Bolingbroke , later Henry IV , and Mary de Bohun , who died before Bolingbroke became king . eos"

"lifetime and Hernan_Cortes signed all Hernan_Cortes letters Fernán Cortés . Born in Medellin , Extremadura , in Castile , to a family of lesser nobility , Hernan_Cortes as a young man chose to win a livelihood in the New World . Hernan_Cortes went to Hispaniola and later to Cuba , where Hernan_Cortes received an encomienda and for a period Hernan_Cortes became mayor of a small town . eos"

Hernan_Cortes enmity with the governor of Cuba Diego Velázquez resulted in the latter calling back the expedition in the last moment , an order which was ignored by Hernan_Cortes in an act of disobedience . eos"

"is best known as the author of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings . J._R._R._Tolkien was an Oxford professor of Anglo - Saxon language ( 1925 to 1945 ) and English language and literature ( 1945 to 1959 ) . J._R._R._Tolkien was a strongly committed Roman Catholic . eos"
"was an Oxford professor of Anglo - Saxon language ( 1925 to 1945 ) and English language and literature ( 1945 to 1959 ) . J._R._R._Tolkien was a strongly committed Roman Catholic . J._R._R._Tolkien was a close friend of C S. Lewis ; they were both members of the informal literary discussion group known as the Inklings . eos"
"was a close friend of C S. Lewis ; they were both members of the informal literary discussion group known as the Inklings . In addition to The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings , J._R._R._Tolkien published fiction includes The Silmarillion and other posthumously published books about what J._R._R._Tolkien called a legendarium , a connected body of tales , fictional histories , invented languages , and other literary essays about an imagined world called Arda , and Middle - earth ( derived from middangeard , the lands inhabitable by Men ) in particular , loosely identified as an ` ` alternative '' remote past of our own world . Most of these works were compiled from J._R._R._Tolkien notes by J._R._R._Tolkien son Christopher Tolkien . eos"
"notes by J._R._R._Tolkien son Christopher Tolkien . The enduring popularity and influence of J._R._R._Tolkien works have led to J._R._R._Tolkien being popularly identified as the ` ` father of modern fantasy literature '' ; though this title is strictly inaccurate since there were predecessors such as William Morris , Robert E Howard and E R. Eddison , J._R._R._Tolkien did have an indisputable and lasting effect on the field and related media . Many fantasy settings like Dungeons and Dragons and Warcraft owe something , directly or indirectly , to J._R._R._Tolkien . eos"

J._R._R._Tolkien other published fiction includes stories not directly related to the legendarium , some of them originally told to J._R._R._Tolkien children . eos"

"time . James_Clerk_Maxwell is widely regarded as the nineteenth century scientist who had the greatest influence on twentieth century physics , making contributions to the fundamental models of nature . In 1931 , on the centennial anniversary of James_Clerk_Maxwell birthday , Einstein described James_Clerk_Maxwell work as the ` ` most profound and the most fruitful that physics has experienced since the time of Newton . '' eos"
"work as the ` ` most profound and the most fruitful that physics has experienced since the time of Newton . '' Algebraic mathematics with elements of geometry are a feature of much of James_Clerk_Maxwell work . James_Clerk_Maxwell demonstrated that electric and magnetic forces are two complementary aspects of electromagnetism . eos"
"work . James_Clerk_Maxwell demonstrated that electric and magnetic forces are two complementary aspects of electromagnetism . James_Clerk_Maxwell showed that electric and magnetic fields travel through space , in the form of waves , at a constant velocity of 3.0 × 10 ^ 8 m / s . eos"
"FRS RN ( october 27 , 1728 ( OS ) - february 14 , 1779 ) was an English explorer , navigator and cartographer . Ultimately rising to the rank of Captain in the Royal Navy , James_Cook made three voyages to the Pacific Ocean , achieving the first European contact with the eastern coastline of Australia , the European discovery of the Hawaiian Islands , and the first recorded circumnavigation and mapping of Newfoundland and New Zealand . After service in the British merchant navy as a teenager , James_Cook joined the Royal Navy in 1755 , seeing action in the Seven Years ' War , and subsequently surveying and mapping much of the entrance to the Saint Lawrence River during the siege of Quebec . eos"
"made three voyages to the Pacific Ocean , achieving the first European contact with the eastern coastline of Australia , the European discovery of the Hawaiian Islands , and the first recorded circumnavigation and mapping of Newfoundland and New Zealand . After service in the British merchant navy as a teenager , James_Cook joined the Royal Navy in 1755 , seeing action in the Seven Years ' War , and subsequently surveying and mapping much of the entrance to the Saint Lawrence River during the siege of Quebec . This allowed General Wolfe to make his famous stealth attack on the Plains of Abraham , and helped to bring James_Cook to the attention of the Admiralty and Royal Society at a crucial moment both in James_Cook personal career and in the direction of British overseas discovery , and led to James_Cook commission as commander of the HM Bark Endeavour and the first of James_Cook three Pacific voyages in 1766 . eos"
"joined the Royal Navy in 1755 , seeing action in the Seven Years ' War , and subsequently surveying and mapping much of the entrance to the Saint Lawrence River during the siege of Quebec . This allowed General Wolfe to make his famous stealth attack on the Plains of Abraham , and helped to bring James_Cook to the attention of the Admiralty and Royal Society at a crucial moment both in James_Cook personal career and in the direction of British overseas discovery , and led to James_Cook commission as commander of the HM Bark Endeavour and the first of James_Cook three Pacific voyages in 1766 . James_Cook accurately charted many areas and James_Cook recorded several islands and coastlines on European maps for the first time . eos"
"to the attention of the Admiralty and Royal Society at a crucial moment both in James_Cook personal career and in the direction of British overseas discovery , and led to James_Cook commission as commander of the HM Bark Endeavour and the first of James_Cook three Pacific voyages in 1766 . James_Cook accurately charted many areas and James_Cook recorded several islands and coastlines on European maps for the first time . James_Cook huge achievements can be attributed to a combination of excellent seamanship , James_Cook superior surveying and cartographic skills , courage in exploring dangerous locations to confirm the facts ( eg dipping into the Antarctic circle repeatedly and exploring around the Great Barrier Reef ) , ability to lead men in adverse conditions , and boldness both with regard to the extent of James_Cook explorations and James_Cook willingness to exceed the instructions given to James_Cook by the Admiralty . eos"
"personal career and in the direction of British overseas discovery , and led to James_Cook commission as commander of the HM Bark Endeavour and the first of James_Cook three Pacific voyages in 1766 . James_Cook accurately charted many areas and James_Cook recorded several islands and coastlines on European maps for the first time . James_Cook huge achievements can be attributed to a combination of excellent seamanship , James_Cook superior surveying and cartographic skills , courage in exploring dangerous locations to confirm the facts ( eg dipping into the Antarctic circle repeatedly and exploring around the Great Barrier Reef ) , ability to lead men in adverse conditions , and boldness both with regard to the extent of James_Cook explorations and James_Cook willingness to exceed the instructions given to James_Cook by the Admiralty . eos"
"huge achievements can be attributed to a combination of excellent seamanship , James_Cook superior surveying and cartographic skills , courage in exploring dangerous locations to confirm the facts ( eg dipping into the Antarctic circle repeatedly and exploring around the Great Barrier Reef ) , ability to lead men in adverse conditions , and boldness both with regard to the extent of James_Cook explorations and James_Cook willingness to exceed the instructions given to James_Cook by the Admiralty . James_Cook died in Hawaii in a fracas with Hawaiians during James_Cook third exploratory voyage in the Pacific in 1779 . eos"

James_Joyce fictional universe is firmly rooted in Dublin and reflects James_Joyce family life and the events and friends ( and enemies ) from James_Joyce school and college days . "is most famous for James_Parkinson 1817 work , Palsy , in which James_Parkinson was the first to describe paralysis agitans , a condition that would later acquire James_Parkinson namesake known as Parkinson 's Disease . James_Parkinson was born in Shoreditch , London , England . James_Parkinson was the son of John Parkinson , an apothecary and surgeon practicing in Hoxton Square in London . eos"
"was the son of John Parkinson , an apothecary and surgeon practicing in Hoxton Square in London . In 1784 James_Parkinson was approved by the Corporation of London as a surgeon . On May 21 , 1783 , James_Parkinson married Mary Dale , with whom James_Parkinson subsequently had six children . eos"
"succeeded James_Parkinson father in his practice in Hoxton Square . James_Parkinson believed that any worthwhile physician should know shorthand , at which James_Parkinson was adept . In addition to James_Parkinson flourishing medical practice , James_Parkinson had an avid interest in geology and paleontology , as well as the politics of the day . eos"
"believed that any worthwhile physician should know shorthand , at which James_Parkinson was adept . In addition to James_Parkinson flourishing medical practice , James_Parkinson had an avid interest in geology and paleontology , as well as the politics of the day . James_Parkinson was a strong advocate for the under - privileged , and an outspoken critic of the Pitt - government . eos"
"had an avid interest in geology and paleontology , as well as the politics of the day . James_Parkinson was a strong advocate for the under - privileged , and an outspoken critic of the Pitt - government . James_Parkinson early career was marred by James_Parkinson being involved in a variety of social and revolutionary causes , and some historians think it most likely that James_Parkinson was a strong proponent for the French Revolution . eos"
"was a strong advocate for the under - privileged , and an outspoken critic of the Pitt - government . James_Parkinson early career was marred by James_Parkinson being involved in a variety of social and revolutionary causes , and some historians think it most likely that James_Parkinson was a strong proponent for the French Revolution . James_Parkinson published nearly twenty political pamphlets in the post - French Revolution period , whilst Britain was in political chaos . eos"

Writing under James_Parkinson own name and James_Parkinson pseudonym ` ` Old Hubert '' eos"
