"pseudonym ` ` Old Hubert '' , James_Parkinson called for radical social reforms . James_Parkinson called for representation of the people in the House of Commons , the institution of annual parliaments , and universal suffrage . eos"
"called for radical social reforms . James_Parkinson called for representation of the people in the House of Commons , the institution of annual parliaments , and universal suffrage . James_Parkinson was a member of several secret political societies , including the London Corresponding Society for Reform of Parliamentary Representation . eos"
"was a member of several secret political societies , including the London Corresponding Society for Reform of Parliamentary Representation . In 1794 James_Parkinson membership in the organization led to James_Parkinson being examined under oath before the Privy Council to give evidence about a plot to assassinate King George III . James_Parkinson refused to testify regarding James_Parkinson part in ` ` The Pop - Gun Plot '' , until James_Parkinson was certain James_Parkinson would not be forced to incriminate James_Parkinson . eos"
"membership in the organization led to James_Parkinson being examined under oath before the Privy Council to give evidence about a plot to assassinate King George III . James_Parkinson refused to testify regarding James_Parkinson part in ` ` The Pop - Gun Plot '' , until James_Parkinson was certain James_Parkinson would not be forced to incriminate James_Parkinson . The plan was to use a poisoned dart fired from a ` ` pop gun '' to bring the king 's reign to a premature conclusion . eos"
"turned away from James_Parkinson tumultuous political career , and between 1799 and 1807 James_Parkinson published a number of medical works , including a work on gout in 1805 . James_Parkinson was also responsible for the earliest writings on the subject of peritonitis in English medical literature . James_Parkinson was also interested in improving the general health and well - being of the population . eos"
"published a number of medical works , including a work on gout in 1805 . James_Parkinson was also responsible for the earliest writings on the subject of peritonitis in English medical literature . James_Parkinson was also interested in improving the general health and well - being of the population . eos"
"was also interested in improving the general health and well - being of the population . James_Parkinson wrote several medical doctrines that exposed a similar zeal for the health and welfare of the people that was expressed by James_Parkinson political activism . James_Parkinson was a crusader for legal protection for the mentally ill , as well as their doctors and families . eos"
"wrote several medical doctrines that exposed a similar zeal for the health and welfare of the people that was expressed by James_Parkinson political activism . James_Parkinson was a crusader for legal protection for the mentally ill , as well as their doctors and families . In 1812 James_Parkinson assisted James_Parkinson son with the first described case of appendicitis in English , and the first instance in which perforation was shown to be the cause of death . eos"
"assisted James_Parkinson son with the first described case of appendicitis in English , and the first instance in which perforation was shown to be the cause of death . James_Parkinson interest gradually turned from medicine to nature , specifically the relatively new field of geology , and paleontology . James_Parkinson began collecting specimens and drawings of fossils in the latter part of the eighteenth century . eos"
"belonged to a school of thought , Catastrophism , that concerned itself with the belief that the Earth 's geology and biosphere were shaped by recent large - scale cataclysms . James_Parkinson cited the Noachian deluge of Genesis as an example , and James_Parkinson firmly believed that creation and extinction were processes guided by the hand of God . James_Parkinson view on Creation was that each ` day ' was actually a much longer period , that lasted perhaps tens of thousands of years in length . eos"
"also contributed several papers to William Nicholson 's ` ` A Journal of Natural Philosophy , Chemistry and the Arts '' , and in the first , second , and fifth volumes of the ` ` Geological Society 's Transactions '' . eos"
"( born May 27 , 1931 ) is the Ronald Reagan professor of public policy at Pepperdine University in California , and a professor emeritus at UCLA . From 1961 to 1987 James_Q._Wilson was a professor of government at Harvard University . eos"
"is a former Chairman of the White House Task Force on Crime ( 1966 ) , of the National Advisor Commission on Drug Abuse Prevention ( 1972 - 73 ) and a member of the Attorney General 's Task Force on Violent Crime ( 1981 ) , the President 's Foreign Intelligence Advisory Board ( 1985 - 90 ) , and the President 's Council on Bioethics . James_Q._Wilson is a former president of the American Political Science Association . James_Q._Wilson has served on the board of directors for the New England Electric System , Protection One , RAD and State Farm Mutual Insurance . eos"
"is the chairman of the Council of Academic Advisors of the American Enterprise Institute . James_Q._Wilson is a member of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences and the American Philosophical Society . James_Q._Wilson was awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom by President George W Bush in 2003 . eos"

", CC , CQ , Dhc ( b. august 31 , 1931 in Trois - Rivières , Quebec , Canada ) was a professional ice hockey player . Jean_Beliveau is a Canadian icon , and one of the most respected figures to have ever played the game . eos"
"joined the Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League ( NHL ) . Three years later , in 1956 , Jean_Beliveau won both the Art Ross Memorial Trophy as the league 's scoring champion and the Hart Memorial Trophy as its most valuable player . During Jean_Beliveau 18 year career in Montreal , Jean_Beliveau played on 10 Stanley Cup winning teams and Jean_Beliveau eos"
"18 year career in Montreal , Jean_Beliveau played on 10 Stanley Cup winning teams and Jean_Beliveau was team captain for five of them . A powerful skater , Jean_Beliveau had a polished air of composed confidence that made Jean_Beliveau a natural leader both on and off the ice . eos"
"retired at the end of the 1970 - 71 NHL season as Jean_Beliveau team 's all - time leading scorer and the NHL 's all - time leading playoff scorer . Jean_Beliveau scored 507 goals and Jean_Beliveau had 712 assists for 1,219 points in 1,125 NHL regular - season games plus 70 goals and 97 assists for 176 points in 162 playoff games . Jean_Beliveau jersey number ( # 4 ) was retired on october 9 , 1971 . eos"
"team 's all - time leading scorer and the NHL 's all - time leading playoff scorer . Jean_Beliveau jersey number ( # 4 ) was retired on october 9 , 1971 . eos"

"was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame . After Jean_Beliveau playing days were over , Jean_Beliveau remained with the Canadiens team as an executive and goodwill ambassador while doing charitable work through the ` ` Jean Béliveau Foundation '' established in 1971 . In 1993 Jean_Beliveau transferred the foundation to the ` ` Society for Disabled Children . '' eos"

"is commonly referred to as Jesus Christ , where ` ` Christ '' is a title derived from the Greek christos , meaning ` ` Anointed One '' , which corresponds to the Hebrew - derived ` ` Messiah '' . The main sources of information regarding Jesus life and teachings are the four canonical Gospels of the New Testament : Matthew , Mark , Luke , and John . eos"
"life and teachings are the four canonical Gospels of the New Testament : Matthew , Mark , Luke , and John . Most scholars in the fields of biblical studies and history agree that Jesus was a Jewish teacher from Galilee , Jesus was regarded as a healer , Jesus was baptized by John the Baptist , and Jesus was crucified in Jerusalem on orders of the Roman Governor Pontius Pilate under the accusation of sedition against the Roman Empire . eos"
"was regarded as a healer , Jesus was baptized by John the Baptist , and Jesus was crucified in Jerusalem on orders of the Roman Governor Pontius Pilate under the accusation of sedition against the Roman Empire . A small minority of scholars and authors question the evidence regarding the historical existence of Jesus . Christian views of Jesus ( see Christology ) center on the belief in Jesus as the Messiah or Christ promised in the Old Testament and in Jesus resurrection after Jesus crucifixion . eos"
". Christian views of Jesus ( see Christology ) center on the belief in Jesus as the Messiah or Christ promised in the Old Testament and in Jesus resurrection after Jesus crucifixion . Christians typically believe in Jesus as the Son of God sent to provide salvation and reconciliation with God by atoning for the sins of humanity . eos"
"( see Christology ) center on the belief in Jesus as the Messiah or Christ promised in the Old Testament and in Jesus resurrection after Jesus crucifixion . Christians typically believe in Jesus as the Son of God sent to provide salvation and reconciliation with God by atoning for the sins of humanity . Trinitarian Christians ( the majority ) believe that Jesus is God incarnate , while Nontrinitarian Christians profess various other interpretations regarding Jesus divinity . eos"

"is a saint of the Roman Catholic Church . Joan_of_Arc asserted that Joan_of_Arc had visions from God which told Joan_of_Arc to recover Joan_of_Arc homeland from English domination late in the Hundred Years ' War . The uncrowned King Charles VII sent Joan_of_Arc to the siege at Orléans as part of a relief mission . eos"
"overcame the light regard of veteran commanders and Joan_of_Arc lifted the siege in only nine days . Several more swift victories led to Charles VII 's coronation at Reims and settled the disputed succession to the throne . The renewed French confidence outlasted Joan_of_Arc own brief career . eos"
"own brief career . Joan_of_Arc refused to leave the field when Joan_of_Arc was wounded during an attempt to recapture Paris that autumn . Hampered by court intrigues , Joan_of_Arc led only minor companies from then onward and Joan_of_Arc fell prisoner at a skirmish near Compiègne the following spring . eos"

"sacred and secular works for choir , orchestra and solo instruments drew together the strands of the Baroque period and brought it to its ultimate maturity . Although Johann_Sebastian_Bach introduced no new forms , Johann_Sebastian_Bach enriched the prevailing German style with a robust contrapuntal technique , a control of harmonic and motivic organisation from the smallest to the largest scales , and the adaptation of rhythms and textures from abroad , particularly Italy and France . Johann_Sebastian_Bach is regarded as one of the greatest composers of all time . eos"
"introduced no new forms , Johann_Sebastian_Bach enriched the prevailing German style with a robust contrapuntal technique , a control of harmonic and motivic organisation from the smallest to the largest scales , and the adaptation of rhythms and textures from abroad , particularly Italy and France . Johann_Sebastian_Bach is regarded as one of the greatest composers of all time . Revered for their intellectual depth , technical command and artistic beauty , Johann_Sebastian_Bach works include the Brandenburg concertos , the Goldberg Variations , the keyboard suites and partitas , the Mass in B Minor , the St Matthew Passion , The Musical Offering , The Art of Fugue , Sonatas and partitas for solo violin and a large number of cantatas , of which about 220 survive . eos"
"printing technology was most likely an independent invention . Johannes_Gutenberg main contribution may have been in the combination of the use of movable type , the art of making such type , the use of oil - based ink , and the wooden printing press , which was presumably derived from the various presses in use at the time , including those for book - binding and those used in wine - making and in olive - oil production . Johannes_Gutenberg technology for making type is traditionally considered to have included a type metal alloy and a mould for casting type accurately . eos"
"main contribution may have been in the combination of the use of movable type , the art of making such type , the use of oil - based ink , and the wooden printing press , which was presumably derived from the various presses in use at the time , including those for book - binding and those used in wine - making and in olive - oil production . Johannes_Gutenberg technology for making type is traditionally considered to have included a type metal alloy and a mould for casting type accurately . The use of movable type constituted an improvement on the block printing already in use . eos"
"remains a towering figure in the popular image ; in 1999 , the A&amp;E Network ranked Johannes_Gutenberg at # 1 on their ` ` People of the Millennium '' countdown . eos"
"( december 27 , 1571 - november 15 , 1630 ) , a key figure in the scientific revolution , was a German mathematician , astronomer , astrologer , and an early writer of science fiction stories . Johannes_Kepler is best known for Johannes_Kepler laws of planetary motion , based on Johannes_Kepler works Astronomia nova , Harmonice Mundi and the textbook Epitome of Copernican Astronomy . Through Johannes_Kepler career Johannes_Kepler was a mathematics teacher at a Graz seminary school ( later the University of Graz , Austria ) , an assistant to Tycho Brahe , court mathematician to Emperor Rudolf II , mathematics teacher in Linz , Austria , and court astrologer to General Wallenstein . eos"
"was a mathematics teacher at a Graz seminary school ( later the University of Graz , Austria ) , an assistant to Tycho Brahe , court mathematician to Emperor Rudolf II , mathematics teacher in Linz , Austria , and court astrologer to General Wallenstein . Johannes_Kepler also did fundamental work in the field of optics and Johannes_Kepler helped to legitimize the telescopic discoveries of Johannes_Kepler contemporary Galileo Galilei . Johannes_Kepler is sometimes referred to as ` ` the first theoretical astrophysicist '' , although Carl Sagan also referred to Johannes_Kepler as the last scientific astrologer . eos"
"is sometimes referred to as ` ` the first theoretical astrophysicist '' , although Carl Sagan also referred to Johannes_Kepler as the last scientific astrologer . eos"
", GCB , KCMG , PC , QC , DCL , LLD ( january 11 , 1815 - june 6 , 1891 ) was the first Prime Minister of Canada , from july 1 , 1867 to november 5 , 1873 , and also from october 17 , 1878 to june 6 , 1891 . John_A._Macdonald was born on january 11 , 1815 in Glasgow , Scotland . John_A._Macdonald parents were Hugh Macdonald , an unsuccessful merchant , and his wife Helen Shaw , who met in Scotland in 1811 . eos"
"father 's business ventures , John_A._Macdonald family emigrated to Kingston , Upper Canada in 1820 along with thousands of others seeking affordable land and promises of new prosperity . Hugh 's fortunes were to rise there . John_A._Macdonald was educated in the area 's finest schools . eos"
"earned the esteem of many by John_A._Macdonald unsuccessful but solid defence of the American raiders who were captured at the Battle of the Windmill ( 1838 , near Prescott , Ontario ) in the Rebellions of 1837 . In 1843 , at the age of 28 , John_A._Macdonald married John_A._Macdonald cousin Isabella Clark ( 1811 - 1857 ) . Soon after the wedding , Isabella became terribly sick with a mysterious illness . eos"
"sister Margaret and her husband , James Williamson , after Isabella 's death in 1857 . Hugh John went on to become premier of the Province of Manitoba . In 1867 , at the age of 52 , John_A._Macdonald married John_A._Macdonald second wife Susan Agnes Bernard ( 1836 - 1920 ) . eos"

John_Dalton is most well known for John_Dalton advocacy of the atomic theory and John_Dalton research into color blindness sometimes called Daltonism in John_Dalton honor . Around about 1790 John_Dalton seems to have thought of taking up law or medicine , but John_Dalton projects were not met with encouragement from John_Dalton relatives and John_Dalton remained at Kendal until , in the spring of 1793 , John_Dalton moved to Manchester . eos"
"projects were not met with encouragement from John_Dalton relatives and John_Dalton remained at Kendal until , in the spring of 1793 , John_Dalton moved to Manchester . Mainly through John Gough , a blind philosopher to whose aid John_Dalton owed much of John_Dalton scientific knowledge , John_Dalton was appointed teacher of mathematics and natural philosophy at the Manchester Academy . John_Dalton remained in that position until the relocation of the college to York in 1803 , when John_Dalton became a public and private teacher of mathematics and chemistry . eos"

"was assassinated on november 22 , 1963 . Official investigations have repeatedly determined Lee Harvey Oswald was the assassin , but critics allege that Oswald acted as part of a conspiracy or was not involved at all and was framed . John_F._Kennedy assassination is considered to be a defining moment in US history due to its traumatic impact on the nation as well as on the political history of the ensuing decades , John_F._Kennedy subsequent branding as an icon for a new generation of Americans and American aspirations , and for the mystery and conspiracy allegations which surround it . eos"

"( august 29 , 1632 - october 28 , 1704 ) was an influential English philosopher . In epistemology , John_Locke has often been classified as a British Empiricist , along with David Hume and George Berkeley . John_Locke is equally important as a social contract theorist , as John_Locke developed an alternative to the Hobbesian state of nature and John_Locke eos"
"has often been classified as a British Empiricist , along with David Hume and George Berkeley . John_Locke is equally important as a social contract theorist , as John_Locke developed an alternative to the Hobbesian state of nature and John_Locke argued a government could only be legitimate if it received the consent of the governed through a social contract and protected the natural rights of life , liberty , and estate . eos"
"is equally important as a social contract theorist , as John_Locke developed an alternative to the Hobbesian state of nature and John_Locke argued a government could only be legitimate if it received the consent of the governed through a social contract and protected the natural rights of life , liberty , and estate . If such consent was not given , argued John_Locke , citizens had a right of rebellion . eos"
"ideas had an enormous influence on the development of political philosophy , and John_Locke is widely regarded as one of the most influential Enlightenment thinkers and contributors to liberal theory . John_Locke writings , along with those of the writings of many Scottish Enlightenment thinkers , influenced the American revolutionaries as reflected in the American Declaration of Independence . eos"
"is widely regarded as one of the most influential Enlightenment thinkers and contributors to liberal theory . John_Locke writings , along with those of the writings of many Scottish Enlightenment thinkers , influenced the American revolutionaries as reflected in the American Declaration of Independence . eos"

"( june 17 , 1703 - march 2 , 1791 ) was an 18th - century Anglican clergyman and Christian theologian John_Wesley was an early leader in the Methodist movement . Methodism had three rises , the first at Oxford University with the founding of the so - called ` ` Holy Club '' , the second while John_Wesley was parish priest in Savannah , Georgia , and the third in London after John_Wesley return to England . The movement took form from its third rise in the early 1740s with John_Wesley , along with others , itinerant field preaching and the subsequent founding of religious societies for the formation of believers . eos"
", along with others , itinerant field preaching and the subsequent founding of religious societies for the formation of believers . This was the first widely successful evangelical movement in the United Kingdom . John_Wesley Methodist connection included societies throughout England , Scotland , Wales , and Ireland before spreading to other parts of the English - speaking world and beyond . eos"
"Methodist connection included societies throughout England , Scotland , Wales , and Ireland before spreading to other parts of the English - speaking world and beyond . John_Wesley divided John_Wesley religious societies further into classes and bands for intensive accountability and religious instruction . Methodists , under John_Wesley direction , became leaders in many social justice issues of the day including prison reform and abolitionism movements . eos"
"insisted that in this life , the Christian could come to a state where the love of God , or perfect love , reigned supreme in one 's heart . John_Wesley evangelical theology , especially John_Wesley understanding of Christian perfection , was firmly grounded in John_Wesley sacramental theology . John_Wesley continually insisted on the general use of the means of grace ( prayer , Scripture meditation , and Holy Communion , etc . ) as the means by which God transformed the believer . eos"
"sacramental theology . John_Wesley continually insisted on the general use of the means of grace ( prayer , Scripture meditation , and Holy Communion , etc . ) as the means by which God transformed the believer . Throughout John_Wesley life , John_Wesley remained within the Church of England and John_Wesley insisted that John_Wesley movement was well within the bounds of the Anglican Church . eos"
"movement was well within the bounds of the Anglican Church . John_Wesley maverick use of church policy put John_Wesley at odds with many within the Church of England , though toward the end of John_Wesley life John_Wesley was widely respected . eos"
"maverick use of church policy put John_Wesley at odds with many within the Church of England , though toward the end of John_Wesley life John_Wesley was widely respected . eos"

"has lived in France since the mid-1960s . Julia_Kristeva works have an important place in post - structuralist thought . Born in Sliven , Bulgaria , Julia_Kristeva moved to France in december 1965 , when Julia_Kristeva was 24 , escaping Stalinist Bulgarian communism . eos"
"moved to France in december 1965 , when Julia_Kristeva was 24 , escaping Stalinist Bulgarian communism . Julia_Kristeva continued Julia_Kristeva education at several French universities . Julia_Kristeva arrived there just in time to experience the rapidly waning influence of structuralism , which was being challenged by Michel Foucault and Jacques Derrida , among others . eos"
"work can be seen as trying to adapt a psychoanalytic approach to these poststructuralist critiques . Julia_Kristeva travelled to China in the 1970s and Julia_Kristeva wrote About Chinese Women ( 1977 ) about Julia_Kristeva experiences . For example , Julia_Kristeva view of the subject , and its construction , shares many similarities with Sigmund Freud and Jacques Lacan . eos"
"travelled to China in the 1970s and Julia_Kristeva wrote About Chinese Women ( 1977 ) about Julia_Kristeva experiences . For example , Julia_Kristeva view of the subject , and its construction , shares many similarities with Sigmund Freud and Jacques Lacan . However , Julia_Kristeva rejects any formal systematical ( or structuralist ) understanding of the subject in favor of a subject perpetually ` ` in process '' or ` ` in crisis . '' eos"
"wrote About Chinese Women ( 1977 ) about Julia_Kristeva experiences . For example , Julia_Kristeva view of the subject , and its construction , shares many similarities with Sigmund Freud and Jacques Lacan . However , Julia_Kristeva rejects any formal systematical ( or structuralist ) understanding of the subject in favor of a subject perpetually ` ` in process '' or ` ` in crisis . '' eos"
"view of the subject , and its construction , shares many similarities with Sigmund Freud and Jacques Lacan . However , Julia_Kristeva rejects any formal systematical ( or structuralist ) understanding of the subject in favor of a subject perpetually ` ` in process '' or ` ` in crisis . '' In this way , Julia_Kristeva contributes to the poststructuralist critique of essentialized structures , while preserving a psychoanalytic approach . eos"
"rejects any formal systematical ( or structuralist ) understanding of the subject in favor of a subject perpetually ` ` in process '' or ` ` in crisis . '' In this way , Julia_Kristeva contributes to the poststructuralist critique of essentialized structures , while preserving a psychoanalytic approach . One of Julia_Kristeva most important propositions is Julia_Kristeva idea of the semiotic . eos"
"contributes to the poststructuralist critique of essentialized structures , while preserving a psychoanalytic approach . One of Julia_Kristeva most important propositions is Julia_Kristeva idea of the semiotic . Julia_Kristeva use of the term ` semiotic ' here should not be confused with the discipline of semiotics suggested by Ferdinand de Saussure . eos"

"( IPA : "" IPA : "" ˈgaːius ˈjuːlius ˈkaisar "" "" ;) , july 12 or july 13 , 100 BC - march 15 , 44 BC ) was a Roman military and political leader and one of the most influential men in world history . Julius_Caesar played a critical role in the transformation of the Roman Republic into what became the Roman Empire after Julius_Caesar death . eos"
"was also responsible for the first Roman invasion of Britain in 55 BC . Julius_Caesar was widely considered to be one of the foremost military geniuses of Julius_Caesar time , as well as a brilliant politician and one of the ancient world 's strongest leaders . Leading Julius_Caesar legions across the Rubicon eos"
"legions across the Rubicon , Julius_Caesar sparked civil war in 49 BC that left Julius_Caesar the undisputed master of the Roman world . After assuming control of the government , Julius_Caesar began extensive reforms of Roman society and government . eos"
"the undisputed master of the Roman world . After assuming control of the government , Julius_Caesar began extensive reforms of Roman society and government . Julius_Caesar was proclaimed dictator for life , and Julius_Caesar heavily centralized the bureaucracy of the Republic . eos"
"began extensive reforms of Roman society and government . Julius_Caesar was proclaimed dictator for life , and Julius_Caesar heavily centralized the bureaucracy of the Republic . This forced the hand of a friend of Julius_Caesar , Marcus Junius Brutus , who then conspired with others to murder Julius_Caesar and restore the Republic . eos"

"worked on the organization of organic chemistry . As a professor , Justus_von_Liebig devised the modern laboratory - oriented teaching method , and for such innovations , Justus_von_Liebig is regarded as one of the greatest chemistry teachers of all time . Justus_von_Liebig is known as the ` ` father of the fertilizer industry '' for Justus_von_Liebig discovery of nitrogen as an essential plant nutrient , and Justus_von_Liebig formulation of the Law of the Minimum which described the effect of individual nutrients on crops . eos"
"devised the modern laboratory - oriented teaching method , and for such innovations , Justus_von_Liebig is regarded as one of the greatest chemistry teachers of all time . Justus_von_Liebig is known as the ` ` father of the fertilizer industry '' for Justus_von_Liebig discovery of nitrogen as an essential plant nutrient , and Justus_von_Liebig formulation of the Law of the Minimum which described the effect of individual nutrients on crops . Justus_von_Liebig also developed a manufacturing process for beef extract , and Justus_von_Liebig founded a company that later trademarked the Oxo brand beef bouillon cube . eos"

Kemal_Dervis previously was a member of the European Constitutional Convention . eos"

"is the central character in the cycle of legends known as the Matter of Britain . There is disagreement about whether King_Arthur , or a model for King_Arthur , ever actually existed . In the earliest mentions and in Welsh texts , King_Arthur is never given the title ` King ' . eos"
", or a model for King_Arthur , ever actually existed . In the earliest mentions and in Welsh texts , King_Arthur is never given the title ` King ' . An early text refers to King_Arthur as a dux bellorum ( ` war leader ' ) , and medieval Welsh texts often call King_Arthur ameraudur ( ` ` emperor '' ; the word is borrowed from the Latin imperator , which could also mean ` ` war leader '' ) . eos"

", widely known as Le Corbusier ( october 6 , 1887 - august 27 , 1965 ) , was a French Swiss born architect , famous for Le_Corbusier contributions to what is now called modernism , or the International Style . Le_Corbusier was a pioneer in theoretical studies of modern design and Le_Corbusier was dedicated to providing better living conditions for the residents of crowded cities . Le_Corbusier career spanned five decades , with iconic buildings constructed across central Europe , India , Russia , and one structure each in North and South America . eos"
"contributions to what is now called modernism , or the International Style . Le_Corbusier career spanned five decades , with iconic buildings constructed across central Europe , India , Russia , and one structure each in North and South America . eos"
"career spanned five decades , with iconic buildings constructed across central Europe , India , Russia , and one structure each in North and South America . Le_Corbusier was also an urban planner , painter , sculptor , writer and modern furniture designer . eos"

"first book of poetry in Montreal in 1956 and Leonard_Cohen first novel in 1963 . Following Leonard_Cohen breakthrough in the music industry in the late 1960s , Leonard_Cohen became one of the most distinguished and influential songwriters of the late twentieth century . Musically , Leonard_Cohen early songs are based in folk music , both for melodies and instrumentation , but , beginning in the 1970s , Leonard_Cohen work shows the influence of various types of popular music and cabaret music . eos"
"became one of the most distinguished and influential songwriters of the late twentieth century . Musically , Leonard_Cohen early songs are based in folk music , both for melodies and instrumentation , but , beginning in the 1970s , Leonard_Cohen work shows the influence of various types of popular music and cabaret music . Since the 1980s Leonard_Cohen typically has sung in a baritone register , with synthesizers and female backing vocals . eos"
"typically has sung in a baritone register , with synthesizers and female backing vocals . Leonard_Cohen songs are often emotionally heavy and lyrically complex , owing more to the metaphoric word play of poetry than to the conventions of song craft . Leonard_Cohen work often explores the themes of religion , isolation , sex , and complex interpersonal relationships . eos"
"is iconic in Leonard_Cohen native land , having been inducted into the Canadian Music Hall of Fame and the Canadian Songwriters Hall of Fame . Leonard_Cohen is a Companion of the Order of Canada , the nation 's highest civilian honour . eos"

"( december 27 1822 - september 28 1895 ) was a French microbiologist and chemist . Louis_Pasteur is best known for demonstrating how to prevent milk and wine from going sour , which came to be called pasteurization . Louis_Pasteur experiments confirmed the germ theory of disease , and Louis_Pasteur created the first vaccine for rabies . eos"
"is best known for demonstrating how to prevent milk and wine from going sour , which came to be called pasteurization . Louis_Pasteur experiments confirmed the germ theory of disease , and Louis_Pasteur created the first vaccine for rabies . Louis_Pasteur became one of the main founders of bacteriology , the other major figure being Robert Koch . eos"
"became one of the main founders of bacteriology , the other major figure being Robert Koch . Louis_Pasteur also made many discoveries in the field of chemistry , most notably the asymmetry of crystals . Louis_Pasteur was born in Dole in the Jura region of France and Louis_Pasteur grew up in the town of Arbois . eos"
"father , Jean Pasteur , was a tanner and a veteran of the Napoleonic wars . Louis_Pasteur aptitude was recognized by Louis_Pasteur college headmaster , who recommended that Louis_Pasteur apply for the École Normale Supérieure , which accepted Louis_Pasteur . After serving briefly as professor of physics at Dijon Lycee in 1848 , Louis_Pasteur became professor of chemistry at Strasbourg University , where Louis_Pasteur met and courted Marie Laurent , daughter of the university 's rector in 1849 . eos"
". After serving briefly as professor of physics at Dijon Lycee in 1848 , Louis_Pasteur became professor of chemistry at Strasbourg University , where Louis_Pasteur met and courted Marie Laurent , daughter of the university 's rector in 1849 . Together they had five children , only two of whom survived to adulthood . eos"

Marie_Curie also became the first woman appointed to teach at the Sorbonne . "( october 15 1880 - october 2 1958 ) was a Scottish author , campaigner for women 's rights and pioneer in the field of family planning . Marie_Stopes edited the journal Birth Control News which gave anatomically explicit advice , and in addition to Marie_Stopes enthusiasm for protests at places of worship this provoked protest from both the Church of England and the Catholic Church . Marie_Stopes sex manual Married Love , which was written while Marie_Stopes was still a virgin , was controversial and influential . eos"
"edited the journal Birth Control News which gave anatomically explicit advice , and in addition to Marie_Stopes enthusiasm for protests at places of worship this provoked protest from both the Church of England and the Catholic Church . Marie_Stopes sex manual Married Love , which was written while Marie_Stopes was still a virgin , was controversial and influential . In 1999 Marie_Stopes was voted ` Woman of the Millennium ' by Guardian newspaper readers in the UK . eos"
"( born october 5 , 1965 , in Ville Emard , Quebec , Canada ) is a retired professional ice hockey centre Mario_Lemieux played 17 seasons for the Pittsburgh Penguins of the National Hockey League between 1984 and 2006 . Mario_Lemieux was also former majority owner of the Penguins before being bought out by Research in Motion Ltd. . Chairman and CEO Jim Balsillie on Friday october 6 , 2006 . Despite having to overcome cancer , and chronic back injuries , Mario_Lemieux is generally regarded as one of the greatest players to have played in the NHL . eos"
"surname , ` ` le mieux '' also literally means ` ` The best '' in French . Mario_Lemieux is the youngest of three sons of Jean - Guy Lemieux and Pierrette Lemieux . Many think that had Mario_Lemieux not missed so many games throughout Mario_Lemieux career due to illness and injury , Mario_Lemieux may have come much closer to Wayne Gretzky 's records as for much of Mario_Lemieux career Mario_Lemieux averaged more points per game . eos"

"has engaged in many spirited debates with other intellectuals , both in the pages of semi - popular magazines and book reviews as well as when testifying as an expert witness in court . Martha_Nussbaum sparring partners have included Allan Bloom , John Finnis and Robert P George , Harvey Mansfield and Judith Butler , among others . Martha_Nussbaum is Ernst Freund Distinguished Service Professor of Law and Ethics at the University of Chicago Law School . eos"

"established that magnetism could affect rays of light and that there was an underlying relationship between the two phenomena . Some historians of science refer to Michael_Faraday as the best experimentalist in the history of science . It was largely due to Michael_Faraday efforts that electricity became viable for use in technology . eos"
"as the best experimentalist in the history of science . It was largely due to Michael_Faraday efforts that electricity became viable for use in technology . The SI unit of capacitance , the farad , is named after Michael_Faraday , as is the Faraday constant , the charge on a mole of electrons ( about 96,485 coulombs ) . eos"

Michael_Faraday law of induction states that a magnetic field changing in time creates a proportional electromotive force . eos"

"output in every field during Michelangelo long life was prodigious ; when the sheer volume of correspondence , sketches and reminiscences that survive is also taken into account , Michelangelo is the best - documented artist of the 16th century . Two of Michelangelo best - known works , the Pieta and the David , were sculpted in Michelangelo late twenties to early thirties . Despite Michelangelo low opinion of painting , Michelangelo also created two of the most influential fresco paintings in the history of Western art : the scenes from Genesis on the ceiling and The Last Judgement on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Rome . eos"
"is the best - documented artist of the 16th century . Two of Michelangelo best - known works , the Pieta and the David , were sculpted in Michelangelo late twenties to early thirties . Despite Michelangelo low opinion of painting , Michelangelo also created two of the most influential fresco paintings in the history of Western art : the scenes from Genesis on the ceiling and The Last Judgement on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Rome . eos"
"late twenties to early thirties . Despite Michelangelo low opinion of painting , Michelangelo also created two of the most influential fresco paintings in the history of Western art : the scenes from Genesis on the ceiling and The Last Judgement on the altar wall of the Sistine Chapel in Rome . Later in life Michelangelo designed the dome of St Peter 's Basilica in the same city and Michelangelo revolutionised classical architecture with Michelangelo invention of the giant order of pilasters . eos"
"was the pinnacle of all artistic achievement since the beginning of the Renaissance , a viewpoint that continued to have currency in art history for centuries . In Michelangelo lifetime Michelangelo was also often called Il Divino ( ` ` the divine one '' ) , an appropriate sobriquet given Michelangelo intense spirituality . One of the qualities most admired by Michelangelo contemporaries was Michelangelo terribilita , a sense of awe - inspiring grandeur , and it was the attempts of subsequent artists to imitate Michelangelo impassioned and highly personal style that resulted in the next major movement in Western art after the High Renaissance , Mannerism . eos"
"lifetime Michelangelo was also often called Il Divino ( ` ` the divine one '' ) , an appropriate sobriquet given Michelangelo intense spirituality . One of the qualities most admired by Michelangelo contemporaries was Michelangelo terribilita , a sense of awe - inspiring grandeur , and it was the attempts of subsequent artists to imitate Michelangelo impassioned and highly personal style that resulted in the next major movement in Western art after the High Renaissance , Mannerism . eos"
"contemporaries was Michelangelo terribilita , a sense of awe - inspiring grandeur , and it was the attempts of subsequent artists to imitate Michelangelo impassioned and highly personal style that resulted in the next major movement in Western art after the High Renaissance , Mannerism . eos"

On april 13 , 2003 , Mike_Weir won the prestigious Masters Tournament at Augusta , Georgia , one of the four Major tournaments in men 's golf . Mike_Weir is the first Canadian ever to win a professional major championship ( Sandy Somerville won the US Amateur when it was considered a major tournament ) . eos"
"is a right - hander Mike_Weir plays golf left - handed ; a trait Mike_Weir shares with fellow PGA Tour pro Phil Mickelson . In june 2003 , Mike_Weir tied for third at the US Open , the second of the majors in the annual schedule . eos"
"was in the top ten in PGA Tour player rankings and in the top 3 in the Official World Golf Rankings . In february 2004 , Mike_Weir joined the ranks of a select few players including Ben Hogan to win back to back championships at the Nissan Open , becoming the sixth player in Nissan Open history to notch back - to - back wins and the first since Corey Pavin ( 1994 , 1995 ) . Mike_Weir is the 20th player to post multiple wins at the Nissan Open . eos"

"( born july 31 , 1912 ) is an American economist , known for Milton_Friedman work on macroeconomics , microeconomics , economic history , statistics , and for Milton_Friedman advocacy of laissez - faire capitalism . In Capitalism and Freedom ( 1962 ) Milton_Friedman minimized the role of government in a free market in order to create political and social freedom . eos"

"achievements in the fields of consumption analysis , monetary history and theory and for Milton_Friedman demonstration of the complexity of stabilization policy . "television series Free to Choose aired on PBS in early 1980 . It became a book , co - authored with Milton_Friedman wife , Rose Friedman . The book was widely read , as were Milton_Friedman columns for Newsweek magazine . eos"
"devised the Friedman test , a non - parametric analogue to the two - way analysis of variance . eos"
"( Persian : سید محمد خاتمی ) , born on september 29 , 1943 in Ardakan city of Yazd province , is an Iranian intellectual , philosopher and political figure . Mohammad_Khatami served as the fifth President of Iran from august 2 , 1997 to august 2 , 2005 and Mohammad_Khatami was succeeded by Mahmoud Ahmadinejad . eos"
"because Mohammad_Khatami promised to improve the status of women and respond to the demands of the young generation in Iran . The day of Mohammad_Khatami election , the 2nd of Khordad , 1376 in the Iranian calendar , is regarded as the starting date of ` ` reforms '' in Iran . Mohammad_Khatami followers or anybody who was following that current are therefore usually known as the ` ` 2nd of Khordad Movement '' . eos"

Mordecai_Richler had little tolerance for pomposity , pretense or provincialism . Often derisive of the Quebec separatists , Mordecai_Richler was a critic of Quebec 's restrictive language laws . eos"

"one of the world 's most famous people , and Mother_Teresa was beatified by Pope John Paul II in october 2003 . Hence , Mother_Teresa may be properly called Blessed Teresa by Catholics . Born in Skopje , Ottoman Empire ( located in modern - day Macedonia ) , at 18 Mother_Teresa left home to join the Sisters of Loretto . eos"
"may be properly called Blessed Teresa by Catholics . Born in Skopje , Ottoman Empire ( located in modern - day Macedonia ) , at 18 Mother_Teresa left home to join the Sisters of Loretto . In 1962 , Mother_Teresa received the Magsaysay Award for Peace and International Understanding . eos"
"received the Magsaysay Award for Peace and International Understanding . In 1971 , Mother_Teresa was awarded the Pope John XXIII Peace Prize . Mother_Teresa was also awarded the Templeton Prize in 1973 , the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979 , and India 's highest civilian award , the Bharat Ratna , in 1980 . eos"
"was presented with the Presidential Medal of Freedom in 1985 , Mother_Teresa was made an Honorary Citizen of the United States ( one of only two people to have this honor during their lifetime ) in 1996 , and Mother_Teresa received the Congressional Gold Medal in 1997 . Mother_Teresa was the first and only person to be featured on an Indian postage stamp while still alive . While Mother_Teresa supporters sometimes referred to Mother_Teresa as the ` ` Angel of Mercy '' and ` ` Saint of the Gutter , '' critics have raised questions about Mother_Teresa public statements , working practices , political connections , and the use of funds donated to Mother_Teresa charity . eos"

"united the tribes of the Arabian Peninsula into a federation of allied tribes with its capital at Medina . Muhammad is considered a prophet in both the Islamic and Baha'i religious traditions . Muslims do not regard Muhammad as the founder of a new religion , but rather believe Muhammad to be the last in a line of prophets of God ( Arabic Allah ) and regard Muhammad mission as one of restoring the original monotheistic faith of Adam , Abraham and other prophets that had become corrupted ( only misinterpreted according to the majority of early and some modern scholars ) by man over time . eos"
"to be the last in a line of prophets of God ( Arabic Allah ) and regard Muhammad mission as one of restoring the original monotheistic faith of Adam , Abraham and other prophets that had become corrupted ( only misinterpreted according to the majority of early and some modern scholars ) by man over time . For the last 23 years of Muhammad life , beginning at the age of forty , Muhammad reported receiving revelations from God delivered through the angel Gabriel . The content of these revelations , known as the Qur ` an , was memorized and recorded by Muhammad followers and compiled into a single volume shortly after Muhammad death . eos"

"( IPA ) ( born july 18 , 1918 ) was the first President of South Africa to be elected in fully - representative democratic elections . Before Nelson_Mandela presidency Nelson_Mandela was a prominent anti - apartheid activist and leader of the African National Congress . Nelson_Mandela was tried and imprisoned for Nelson_Mandela involvement in underground armed resistance activities . eos"
"presidency Nelson_Mandela was a prominent anti - apartheid activist and leader of the African National Congress . Nelson_Mandela was tried and imprisoned for Nelson_Mandela involvement in underground armed resistance activities . The armed struggle was a last resort ; Nelson_Mandela had remained steadfastly committed to non - violence . eos"
"had remained steadfastly committed to non - violence . Through Nelson_Mandela 27-year imprisonment , much of it spent in a cell on Robben Island , Nelson_Mandela became the most widely known figure in the struggle against South African apartheid . Although the apartheid regime and nations sympathetic to it considered Nelson_Mandela and the ANC to be communists and terrorists , the armed struggle was an integral part of the overall campaign against apartheid . eos"
"( b. april 18 , 1964 in Glasgow , Scotland ) is a widely published and controversial British historian of modern imperialism . Niall_Ferguson was educated as a Demy at Magdalen College , Oxford , graduating with a first class honours degree . Niall_Ferguson is the Laurence A Tisch Professor of History at Harvard University , a Senior Research Fellow of Jesus College , Oxford University and a Senior Fellow of the Hoover Institution , Stanford University . eos"
"was educated as a Demy at Magdalen College , Oxford , graduating with a first class honours degree . Niall_Ferguson is a specialist in financial and economic history . eos"
"( february 19 , 1473 - May 24 , 1543 ) was an astronomer Nicolaus_Copernicus provided the first modern formulation of a heliocentric ( sun - centered ) theory of the solar system in Nicolaus_Copernicus epochal book , De revolutionibus orbium coelestium ( On the Revolutions of the Celestial Spheres ) . Nicolaus_Copernicus was one of the great polymaths of the Renaissance . eos"

Amid Nicolaus_Copernicus extensive responsibilities , Nicolaus_Copernicus treated astronomy as an avocation . eos"

", PhD ( born december 7 , 1928 ) is the Institute Professor Emeritus of linguistics at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology . Noam_Chomsky is credited with the creation of the theory of generative grammar , considered to be one of the most significant contributions to the field of theoretical linguistics made in the 20th century . Noam_Chomsky also helped spark the cognitive revolution in psychology through Noam_Chomsky review of BF Skinner 's Verbal Behavior , in which Noam_Chomsky challenged the behaviorist approach to the study of mind and language dominant in the 1950s . eos"
"media criticism and radical politics than for Noam_Chomsky linguistic theories . Noam_Chomsky is generally considered to be a key intellectual figure within the left wing of United States politics . According to the Arts and Humanities Citation Index , between 1980 and 1992 Noam_Chomsky was cited as a source more often than any other living scholar , and the eighth most cited scholar overall . eos"
"critique of the Vietnam War in the 1960s , Noam_Chomsky has become more widely known - especially internationally - for Noam_Chomsky media criticism and radical politics than for Noam_Chomsky linguistic theories . Noam_Chomsky is generally considered to be a key intellectual figure within the left wing of United States politics . According to the Arts and Humanities Citation Index , between 1980 and 1992 Noam_Chomsky was cited as a source more often than any other living scholar , and the eighth most cited scholar overall . eos"
"political activism , and for Noam_Chomsky criticism of the foreign policy of the United States and other governments . Noam_Chomsky describes Noam_Chomsky as a libertarian socialist and a sympathizer of anarcho - syndicalism ( Noam_Chomsky is a member of the IWW ) . eos"
"criticism of the foreign policy of the United States and other governments . Noam_Chomsky describes Noam_Chomsky as a libertarian socialist and a sympathizer of anarcho - syndicalism ( Noam_Chomsky is a member of the IWW ) . eos"
"as a libertarian socialist and a sympathizer of anarcho - syndicalism ( Noam_Chomsky is a member of the IWW ) . eos"
"( april 25 1599 - september 3 1658 ) was an English military and political leader best known for making England a republic and leading the Commonwealth of England . For the first forty years of Oliver_Cromwell life a middling gentry farmer , Oliver_Cromwell rose from the ranks to command the Army and eventually to impose Oliver_Cromwell rule on England , Scotland , and Ireland as Lord Protector , from december 16 1653 until Oliver_Cromwell death . Oliver_Cromwell is a very controversial figure in English history - a regicidal dictator to some historians ( such as David Hume and Christopher Hill ) and a hero of liberty to others ( such as Thomas Carlyle and Samuel Rawson Gardiner . ) eos"
"is a very controversial figure in English history - a regicidal dictator to some historians ( such as David Hume and Christopher Hill ) and a hero of liberty to others ( such as Thomas Carlyle and Samuel Rawson Gardiner . ) Oliver_Cromwell was a regicide Oliver_Cromwell debated whether to accept the crown himself and decided not - though ironically Oliver_Cromwell had more power than Charles I Oliver_Cromwell was a parliamentarian Oliver_Cromwell ordered Oliver_Cromwell soldiers to dissolve parliaments . eos"
"was a regicide Oliver_Cromwell debated whether to accept the crown himself and decided not - though ironically Oliver_Cromwell had more power than Charles I Oliver_Cromwell was a parliamentarian Oliver_Cromwell ordered Oliver_Cromwell soldiers to dissolve parliaments . Oliver_Cromwell was devoted to Christian values yet eos"
"had more power than Charles I Oliver_Cromwell was a parliamentarian Oliver_Cromwell ordered Oliver_Cromwell soldiers to dissolve parliaments . Oliver_Cromwell was devoted to Christian values yet eos"
"conquests of Scotland and Ireland were brutal . Oliver_Cromwell advocated religious liberty of conscience but Oliver_Cromwell allowed blasphemers to be tortured . Oliver_Cromwell advocated equitable justice eos"
"allowed blasphemers to be tortured . Oliver_Cromwell advocated equitable justice but Oliver_Cromwell imprisoned those who criticized Oliver_Cromwell raising taxation outside the agreement of Parliament . eos"
"raising taxation outside the agreement of Parliament . Admirers hail Oliver_Cromwell as a strong , stabilizing and stately leader Oliver_Cromwell brought international respect , Oliver_Cromwell overthrew tyranny and Oliver_Cromwell promoted republicanism and liberty . eos"
"brought international respect , Oliver_Cromwell overthrew tyranny and Oliver_Cromwell promoted republicanism and liberty . In a BBC poll of Great Britons , Oliver_Cromwell was voted number 10 . eos"
"was voted number 10 . Oliver_Cromwell critics ridiculed Oliver_Cromwell as an overly ambitious hypocrite Oliver_Cromwell betrayed the cause of liberty , Oliver_Cromwell imposed puritanical values and Oliver_Cromwell showed scant respect for the nation 's traditions . When the Royalists returned to power , Oliver_Cromwell corpse was dug up , hung in chains , and beheaded . eos"

"( april 28 , 1908 - october 9 , 1974 ) was a Sudeten German industrialist Oskar_Schindler saved Oskar_Schindler Jewish workers from the Holocaust . Oskar_Schindler saved as many as 1,200 Jews by having them work in Oskar_Schindler enamelware and munitions factories located in Poland and what is now the Czech Republic . Oskar_Schindler was the subject of the film Schindler 's List . eos"

", Prince von Bismarck , Duke of Lauenburg ( april 1 , 1815 - july 30 , 1898 ) was one of the most prominent European aristocrats and statesmen of the nineteenth century . As Minister - President of Prussia from 1862 to 1890 , Otto_von_Bismarck engineered the unification of the numerous states of Germany . From 1867 on , Otto_von_Bismarck was Chancellor of the North German Confederation . eos"
"served as its first Chancellor . Otto_von_Bismarck was made the Count of Bismarck - Schönhausen in 1865 , and in 1871 Otto_von_Bismarck became Prince ( Fürst ) of Bismarck . In 1890 Otto_von_Bismarck was also made the Duke of Lauenburg . eos"
"was made the Count of Bismarck - Schönhausen in 1865 , and in 1871 Otto_von_Bismarck became Prince ( Fürst ) of Bismarck . In 1890 Otto_von_Bismarck was also made the Duke of Lauenburg . The ducal title , which Otto_von_Bismarck received upon Otto_von_Bismarck dismissal from office , Otto_von_Bismarck refused initially only to later accept , which was the highest rank of the non - sovereign nobility , and was styled Serene Highness . eos"
"was also made the Duke of Lauenburg . The ducal title , which Otto_von_Bismarck received upon Otto_von_Bismarck dismissal from office , Otto_von_Bismarck refused initially only to later accept , which was the highest rank of the non - sovereign nobility , and was styled Serene Highness . Otto_von_Bismarck is also known as the Iron Chancellor ( ` ` der eiserne Kanzler '' ) . eos"
"instigated an ultimately unsuccessful revolt against English rule of Wales . Owain_Glyndower was a descendant of the princes of Powys from Owain_Glyndower father Gruffydd Fychan II , Hereditary Tywysog of Powys Fadog and Lord of Glyndyfrdwy , and of those of Deheubarth through Owain_Glyndower mother Elen ferch Tomas ap Llywelyn . eos"
"has remained a notable figure in the popular culture of both Wales and England , portrayed in Shakespeare 's play Henry IV as a wild and exotic man ruled by magic and emotion . In the late 19th century the ` ` Young Wales '' movement recreated Owain_Glyndower as the father of Welsh nationalism , revising the historical image of Owain_Glyndower as a purely local leader and joining Owain_Glyndower in popular memory as a national hero on a par with King Arthur . In 2000 celebrations were held all over Wales to commemorate the 600th anniversary of the rising . eos"
"as a purely local leader and joining Owain_Glyndower in popular memory as a national hero on a par with King Arthur . In 2000 celebrations were held all over Wales to commemorate the 600th anniversary of the rising . eos"

"( IPA pronunciation : "" IPA : "" ʁwa "" "" ) , ( born october 5 , 1965 , in Quebec City , Quebec , Canada ) is a retired ice hockey goaltender and current co - owner , general manager , and head coach of the Quebec Remparts of the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League . Nicknamed ` ` St. Patrick , '' and adored by fans of the Montreal Canadiens and Colorado Avalanche , Patrick_Roy is the National Hockey League 's all - time leader in both wins and games played by a goaltender , and Patrick_Roy is widely regarded as one of the greatest goaltenders of all time . On november 13 , 2006 , Patrick_Roy was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame . eos"
"graduated with first class honors in history , and Paul_Kennedy received his doctorate from Oxford . Paul_Kennedy was a Professor of History at the University of East Anglia between 1970 and 1983 . Paul_Kennedy is a Fellow of the Royal Historical Society , a former Visiting Fellow of the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton University , and of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation in Germany . eos"
"was a Professor of History at the University of East Anglia between 1970 and 1983 . Paul_Kennedy is a Fellow of the Royal Historical Society , a former Visiting Fellow of the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton University , and of the Alexander von Humboldt Foundation in Germany . Paul_Kennedy was made a Commander of the British Empire in 2001 . Paul_Kennedy is the J Richardson Dilworth professor of British history at Yale University in New Haven , Connecticut . eos"
"most famous book , The Rise and Fall of the Great Powers , has been translated into 23 languages and assesses the interaction between economics and strategy over the past five centuries . eos"
", MBE , ( born june 18 , 1942 ) is an English songwriter , musician and singer , best known as a member of The Beatles and one half of the songwriting partnership known as Lennon / McCartney . Paul_McCartney was a member of the The Beatles ( ` the greatest and most influential act of the rock era ' ) , As a Beatle , Paul_McCartney was one - half of the songwriting team credited as Lennon / McCartney , along with fellow band member John Lennon . eos"
"include ` ` Ca n't Buy Me Love '' , ` ` Hello Goodbye '' , ` ` Hey Jude '' , ` ` Let It Be '' , and ` ` The Long and Winding Road . Paul_McCartney song ` ` Yesterday '' is listed as the most covered song in history : more than 2,000 versions have been recorded , and it has been played more than 7,000,000 times on American TV and radio . Following the announcement of Paul_McCartney departure from The Beatles on 10 april 1970 , Paul_McCartney launched a successful solo career ( Paul_McCartney released Paul_McCartney first album on 17 april 1970 ) and Paul_McCartney formed the band Wings - scoring 30 top ten singles in the United Kingdom and United States . eos"
"departure from The Beatles on 10 april 1970 , Paul_McCartney launched a successful solo career ( Paul_McCartney released Paul_McCartney first album on 17 april 1970 ) and Paul_McCartney formed the band Wings - scoring 30 top ten singles in the United Kingdom and United States . The keyboardist for Wings was Paul_McCartney first wife , Linda McCartney . At the time of its release , in 1977 , the Wings single ` ` Mull of Kintyre '' was the highest - selling record in British chart history ( and remained so until 1984 ) . eos"
"first wife , Linda McCartney . "( d. c. 65 ) , St. Paul , known as the Apostle to the Gentiles , was the most notable Christian missionary , together with the apostle St. Peter . eos"
"own account in Paul_of_Tarsus various letters . Paul_of_Tarsus letters are largely written to churches which Paul_of_Tarsus had founded or visited ; Paul_of_Tarsus was a great traveller , going to Cyprus , Asia Minor ( modern Turkey ) , mainland Greece , Crete and Rome bringing the gospel of Jesus Christ , first to Jews and then to Gentiles . Paul_of_Tarsus letters are full of expositions of what Christians should believe and how they should live ; what Paul_of_Tarsus does not do is to tell Paul_of_Tarsus correspondents ( or the modern reader ) much about the life and teachings of Jesus . eos"
"letters are full of expositions of what Christians should believe and how they should live ; what Paul_of_Tarsus does not do is to tell Paul_of_Tarsus correspondents ( or the modern reader ) much about the life and teachings of Jesus . Paul_of_Tarsus most explicit references are to the Last Supper , the crucifixion and the resurrection ; raising the question , still disputed , as to how consistent Paul_of_Tarsus version of the Christian faith is with that of the Gospels . Paul_of_Tarsus influence on Christian thinking has , arguably been more significant than any one other New Testament writer . eos"
"most explicit references are to the Last Supper , the crucifixion and the resurrection ; raising the question , still disputed , as to how consistent Paul_of_Tarsus version of the Christian faith is with that of the Gospels . Paul_of_Tarsus influence on Christian thinking has , arguably been more significant than any one other New Testament writer . Paul_of_Tarsus works were hugely influential on some of the great Christian thinkers and leaders of movements , including St. Augustine of Hippo and Martin Luther the instigator of the European Protestant Reformation and even upon the German church in the twentieth century through the interpretive writings of the scholar Karl Barth . eos"

"lectured extensively at the Academy , and Plato wrote on many philosophical issues , dealing especially in politics , ethics , metaphysics , and epistemology . The most important writings of Plato are Plato dialogues , although some letters have come down to us under Plato name . It is believed that all of Plato authentic dialogues survive . eos"
"name . It is believed that all of Plato authentic dialogues survive . However , some dialogues ascribed to Plato by the Greeks are now considered by the consensus of scholars to be either suspect ( eg , First Alcibiades , Clitophon ) or probably spurious ( such as Demodocus , or the Second Alcibiades ) . eos"
"authentic dialogues survive . However , some dialogues ascribed to Plato by the Greeks are now considered by the consensus of scholars to be either suspect ( eg , First Alcibiades , Clitophon ) or probably spurious ( such as Demodocus , or the Second Alcibiades ) . The letters are all considered to probably be spurious , with the possible exception of the Seventh Letter . eos"

"is viewed as a defender of traditional Catholic doctrine and values and of their importance in the survival of Western civilization . Pope_Benedict_XVI served as a professor at various German universities , and Pope_Benedict_XVI was a theological consultant at the Second Vatican Council before becoming Archbishop of Munich and Freising and Cardinal . At the time of Pope_Benedict_XVI election as Pope , Pope_Benedict_XVI had been Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith ( curial heads lose their positions upon the death of a pope ) and Pope_Benedict_XVI was Dean of the College of Cardinals . eos"
"election as Pope , Pope_Benedict_XVI had been Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith ( curial heads lose their positions upon the death of a pope ) and Pope_Benedict_XVI was Dean of the College of Cardinals . During Pope_Benedict_XVI papacy , Pope_Benedict_XVI has emphasized what Pope_Benedict_XVI sees as a need for Europe to return to fundamental Christian values in response to increasing de - Christianisation and secularisation in many developed countries . For this reason , Pope_Benedict_XVI has identified relativism 's denial of objective truth - and more particularly , the denial of moral truths - as the central problem of the 21st century . eos"

Desiderius , abbot of Monte Cassino , who became Pope Victor III ( 1086 - 87 ) was chosen Pope initially , but after his short reign Pope_Urban_II was elected Pope Urban II by acclamation ( march 1088 ) at a small meeting of cardinals and other prelates held in Terracina . Pope_Urban_II took up the policies of Pope Gregory VII , and while pursuing them with determination , Pope_Urban_II showed greater flexibility , and diplomatic finesse . eos"
"had excommunicated for his adulterous marriage to Bertrade de Montfort , Pope_Urban_II finally proved victorious . "came from a political background : Preston_Manning was the son of Ernest Manning , Social Credit Party Premier of Alberta between 1943 and 1968 . In 1964 , Preston_Manning graduated from the University of Alberta with a BA in Economics . eos"
"was the son of Ernest Manning , Social Credit Party Premier of Alberta between 1943 and 1968 . In 1964 , Preston_Manning graduated from the University of Alberta with a BA in Economics . Preston_Manning sought election to the Canadian House of Commons in the 1965 federal election as a candidate of the federal Social Credit Party , but Preston_Manning was defeated . eos"
"formed the Reform Party in 1987 . Preston_Manning chief policy adviser was Stephen Harper , a student at the University of Calgary and now the Prime Minister of Canada . Harper designed the Reform Party 's 1988 campaign platform . eos"
"chief policy adviser was Stephen Harper , a student at the University of Calgary and now the Prime Minister of Canada . Harper designed the Reform Party 's 1988 campaign platform . The Reform Party was a combination of fiscal conservatism and populism , though aspects of social - conservatism grew , branding the party as ` ` very right - wing . '' eos"
"was elected to the House of Commons in the 1993 federal election , when Reform experienced its first major electoral success , replacing the Progressive Conservative Party as Canada 's dominant conservative party , with a base especially in Western Canada . In the 1997 election , the party became Canada 's official opposition , with Preston_Manning becoming the Leader of the Opposition . With Reform 's emergence , however , Preston_Manning fragmented the conservative vote into two parts - Reform and the weakened PC Party . eos"
"launched the United Alternative movement to examine ways for the parties to cooperate . The movement resulted in the formation of a new party , the Canadian Alliance , which as its full name ( Canadian Reform Conservative Alliance ) shows , was intended to supplant both parties . Most of the PC Party , however , refused to cooperate , and critics claimed the new party was little more than an image makeover for the Reform Party . eos"
"was succeeded as leader by the younger and more flamboyant Stockwell Day in 2000 . Preston_Manning published Preston_Manning memoirs of political life , Think eos"
"ends the book by promising to ` ` scout '' the future of Canada ; Preston_Manning is in this sense continuing to write about policy , especially policy that Preston_Manning feels will be detrimental to the future of the country . Preston_Manning founded the Manning Centre for Building Democracy in 2005 to train conservatives for active political life . Preston_Manning also served as Governor General for the British Columbia Universities Model Parliament Society ( BCUMP ) in january 2006 . eos"
"is in this sense continuing to write about policy , especially policy that Preston_Manning feels will be detrimental to the future of the country . "( march 31 , 1596 - february 11 , 1650 ) , also known as Cartesius , was a noted French philosopher , mathematician , and scientist . Dubbed the ` ` Founder of Modern Philosophy '' and the ` ` Father of Modern Mathematics , '' Rene_Descartes ranks as one of the most important and influential thinkers of modern times . For good or bad , much of subsequent western philosophy is a reaction to Rene_Descartes writings , which have been closely studied from Rene_Descartes time down to the present day . eos"
"time down to the present day . Rene_Descartes was one of the key thinkers of the Scientific Revolution in the Western World . Rene_Descartes influence in mathematics is also apparent , the Cartesian coordinate system used in plane geometry and algebra being named after Rene_Descartes . eos"
". Rene_Descartes frequently contrasted Rene_Descartes views with those of Rene_Descartes predecessors . In the opening section of the ` ` Passions of the Soul '' , Rene_Descartes goes so far as to assert that Rene_Descartes will write on Rene_Descartes topic ` ` as if no one had written on these matters before '' . eos"
"differs from the Schools on two major points : first , Rene_Descartes rejects the analysis of corporeal substance into matter and form ; second , Rene_Descartes rejects any appeal to ends - divine or natural - in explaining natural phenomena . In Rene_Descartes theology , Rene_Descartes insists on the absolute freedom of God 's act of creation . Rene_Descartes was a major figure in 17th century continental rationalism , later advocated by Baruch Spinoza and Gottfried Leibniz , and opposed by the empiricist school of thought , consisting of Hobbes , Locke , Berkeley , and Hume . eos"
"was a major figure in 17th century continental rationalism , later advocated by Baruch Spinoza and Gottfried Leibniz , and opposed by the empiricist school of thought , consisting of Hobbes , Locke , Berkeley , and Hume . Leibniz , Spinoza and Rene_Descartes were all versed in mathematics as well as philosophy , and Rene_Descartes and Leibniz contributed greatly to science as well . As the inventor of the Cartesian coordinate system , Rene_Descartes founded analytic geometry , that bridge between algebra and geometry crucial to the invention of the calculus and analysis . eos"
"most famous statement is ` ` Cogito ergo sum '' ( French : ` ` Je pense , donc je suis '' or in English : ` ` I think , therefore I am '' ) , found in § 7 of ` ` Principles of Philosophy '' ( Latin ) and part IV of ` ` Discourse on Method '' ( French ) . eos"

It is estimated that Richard_Branson is worth over £ 3 billion ( equivalent to more than US$ 5 billion ) according to the Sunday Times Rich List 2006 . On the 12th of october , 2006 , Richard_Branson emphasised Richard_Branson stated plan is to invest $ 3 billion over 10 years to fight global warming . eos"

"( born march 261941 ) is an eminent British ethologist , evolutionary scientist , and popular science writer Richard_Dawkins holds the Charles Simonyi Chair in the Public Understanding of Science at Oxford University . Richard_Dawkins first came to prominence with Richard_Dawkins 1976 book The Selfish Gene which popularised the gene - centric view of evolution and introduced the term meme into the lexicon , thereby helping to found the field of memetics . eos"
"first came to prominence with Richard_Dawkins 1976 book The Selfish Gene which popularised the gene - centric view of evolution and introduced the term meme into the lexicon , thereby helping to found the field of memetics . In 1982 , Richard_Dawkins made a major contribution to the science of evolution with the theory , presented in Richard_Dawkins widely cited book The Extended Phenotype , that phenotypic effects are not limited to an organism 's body but can stretch far into the environment , including into the bodies of other organisms . Richard_Dawkins has since written several best - selling popular books on evolution , and Richard_Dawkins has appeared in a number of television and radio programmes on evolutionary biology , creationism , and religion . eos"
"1976 book The Selfish Gene which popularised the gene - centric view of evolution and introduced the term meme into the lexicon , thereby helping to found the field of memetics . In 1982 , Richard_Dawkins made a major contribution to the science of evolution with the theory , presented in Richard_Dawkins widely cited book The Extended Phenotype , that phenotypic effects are not limited to an organism 's body but can stretch far into the environment , including into the bodies of other organisms . Richard_Dawkins has since written several best - selling popular books on evolution , and Richard_Dawkins has appeared in a number of television and radio programmes on evolutionary biology , creationism , and religion . eos"
"made a major contribution to the science of evolution with the theory , presented in Richard_Dawkins widely cited book The Extended Phenotype , that phenotypic effects are not limited to an organism 's body but can stretch far into the environment , including into the bodies of other organisms . Richard_Dawkins has since written several best - selling popular books on evolution , and Richard_Dawkins has appeared in a number of television and radio programmes on evolutionary biology , creationism , and religion . Richard_Dawkins is an outspoken atheist , humanist , and sceptic , and Richard_Dawkins is a prominent member of the Brights movement . eos"
"is a prominent member of the Brights movement . In a play on Thomas Huxley 's epithet ` ` Darwin 's bulldog '' , Richard_Dawkins impassioned defence of Darwinian evolution has earned Richard_Dawkins the appellation ` ` Darwin 's rottweiler '' . eos"
"the appellation ` ` Darwin 's rottweiler '' . eos"
"death . Richard_III_of_England was the last king from the House of York , and Richard_III_of_England defeat ended the Wars of the Roses . After the death of Richard_III_of_England brother King Edward IV , Richard_III_of_England briefly governed as regent for Edward 's son King Edward V with the title of Lord Protector , but Richard_III_of_England placed Edward and his brother Richard in the Tower ( see Princes in the Tower ) and Richard_III_of_England acquired the throne for Richard_III_of_England , being crowned on 6 july 1483 . eos"
"was the last king from the House of York , and Richard_III_of_England defeat ended the Wars of the Roses . After the death of Richard_III_of_England brother King Edward IV , Richard_III_of_England briefly governed as regent for Edward 's son King Edward V with the title of Lord Protector , but Richard_III_of_England placed Edward and his brother Richard in the Tower ( see Princes in the Tower ) and Richard_III_of_England acquired the throne for Richard_III_of_England , being crowned on 6 july 1483 . Two large - scale rebellions rose against Richard_III_of_England . eos"

", 1st Baron Baden - Powell OM , GCMG , GCVO , KCB ( 22 february 1857 - 8 january 1941 ) , also known as B - P , was a Lieutenant - General in the British Army , writer , and founder of the world Scouting Movement . After having been educated at Charterhouse School , Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell joined the British Army in 1876 , and Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell was posted in India and Africa , and Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell served three years in the British Secret Intelligence Service . In 1899 , during the Second Boer War in South Africa , Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell successfully defended Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell fortress and the surrounding city in the Siege of Mafeking . eos"

In 1910 Robert_Baden-Powell_1st_Baron_Baden-Powell retired from the Army . eos"

"( 6 june 1868 - 29 march 1912 ) was a Royal Naval officer and Antarctic explorer . In the so - called ` Race to the South Pole ' Robert_Falcon_Scott came second , behind the Norwegian Roald Amundsen ; and Robert_Falcon_Scott subsequently died , along with four companions , whilst trying to return to the safety of their base . Robert_Falcon_Scott has become the most famous , and tragic , hero of the ` ` heroic age '' of Antarctic exploration . eos"
"has become the most famous , and tragic , hero of the ` ` heroic age '' of Antarctic exploration . eos"
"also developed the influential two - level game theory that assumes international agreements will only be successfully brokered if they also result in domestic benefits . Robert_Putnam most famous ( and controversial ) work , Bowling Alone , argues that the United States has undergone an unprecedented collapse in civic , social , associational , and political life ( social capital ) since the 1960s , with serious negative consequences . Though Robert_Putnam measured this decline in data of many varieties , Robert_Putnam most striking point was that virtually every traditional civic , social and fraternal organization - typified by bowling leagues - had undergone a massive decline in membership while the number of people bowling increased drastically . eos"
"measured this decline in data of many varieties , Robert_Putnam most striking point was that virtually every traditional civic , social and fraternal organization - typified by bowling leagues - had undergone a massive decline in membership while the number of people bowling increased drastically . Robert_Putnam makes a distinction between two kinds of social capital : bonding capital and bridging capital . Bonding occurs when you are socializing with people who are like you : same age , same race , same religion , and so on . eos"
"most striking point was that virtually every traditional civic , social and fraternal organization - typified by bowling leagues - had undergone a massive decline in membership while the number of people bowling increased drastically . Robert_Putnam makes a distinction between two kinds of social capital : bonding capital and bridging capital . Bonding occurs when you are socializing with people who are like you : same age , same race , same religion , and so on . eos"
"argues that those two kinds of social capital , bonding and bridging , do strengthen each other . eos"

"( Greek : Σωκράτης , invariably anglicized as "" IPA : "" sɔkɹətiːz "" "" , Sǒcratēs ; 470 - 399 BC ) was an ancient Greek philosopher Socrates is widely credited for laying the foundation for Western philosophy . eos"
"was born and lived in Athens , where Socrates spent most of Socrates time in enthusiastic pursuit of wisdom ( philosophy ) . Socrates ` ` followed the argument '' in Socrates personal reflection , and in a sustained and rigorous dialogue between friends , followers , and contemporary itinerant teachers of wisdom . Later in Socrates life Socrates became known as the wisest man in all of Greece . eos"
"was commanded to stop Socrates public disputes , and Socrates associations with young aristocrats . Socrates carried on as usual . Finally , Socrates was arrested and accused of corrupting the youth , inventing new deities ( heresy ) , and disbelieving in the divine ( atheism ) . eos"

"( november 29 , 1949 - june 2 , 1983 ) was a Canadian folk musician and songwriter . Stan_Rogers was noted for Stan_Rogers rich , baritone voice and Stan_Rogers finely - crafted , traditional - sounding songs which were frequently inspired by Canadian history and the daily lives of working people , especially those from the fishing villages of the Maritime provinces and , later , the farms of the Canadian prairies . Stan_Rogers died in an airliner accident on the ground at the Greater Cincinnati Airport at the age of 33 . eos"

Stan_Rogers died in an airliner accident on the ground at the Greater Cincinnati Airport at the age of 33 . A larger - than - life figure , Stan_Rogers influence on Canadian folk music has been deep and lasting . eos"

"results were extraordinary . But what set Steve_Redgrave and Steve_Redgrave compatriots apart from their international brethren was not their dominance , but their consistency . They were exceptionally talented , but so were their competitors . eos"
"boats did not win their races easily : Most were hard fought and won by small margins . Four of Steve_Redgrave five Olympic victories were by less than 2 seconds . But race after race , year in and year out , Steve_Redgrave could be found at the top of the medal podium . eos"
"career are even more outstanding when taking into account that Steve_Redgrave was suffering from ulcerative colitis and , since 1997 , diabetes .
